meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: To provide for the regulation and control of the import of articles into Hong Kong, the export of articles from Hong Kong, the handling and carriage of articles within Hong Kong which have been imported into Hong Kong or which may be exported from Hong Kong, and any matter incidental to or connected with the foregoing.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title
section.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Import and Export Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: AirConsignmentNote,AirWaybill
def.leadIn: air consignment note (航空托運單) and air waybill (空運提單) mean any document which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: bears the signature of the owner, operator, charterer, authorized agent or commander of an aircraft; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: records particulars of a contract for the consignment of cargo in an aircraft;

section.def: air transhipment cargo (航空轉運貨物) means transhipment cargo that is both imported and consigned for export in an aircraft and which, during the period between its import and export, remains within the cargo transhipment area of Hong Kong International Airport; (Added 29 of 2000 s. 2)
appointed officer (獲委任人員) means a person appointed by the Director under section 4A; (Added L.N. 294 of 1982)

def.name: ArticleInTransit
def.leadIn: article in transit (過境物品) means an article which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is brought into Hong Kong solely for the purpose of taking it out of Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b

section.def: authorized officer (獲授權人員) means a person authorized by the Commissioner under section 4; (Amended L.N. 294 of 1982)

def.name: BillOfLading
def.leadIn: bill of lading (提單) means any document which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: bears the signature of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the owner, charterer, agent or master of a ship; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the owner, hirer or person in charge of a vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: records particulars of a contract for the consignment of cargo in a vessel or vehicle;

def.name: Cargo
def.leadIn: cargo (貨物) means any article which is imported or exported other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the necessary equipment, stores or fuel of the vessel, aircraft or vehicle in or on which the article is imported or exported;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: food and other provisions reasonably required for consumption by the crew or passengers of such vessel, aircraft or vehicle;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: items of personal property reasonably required for the personal use of the crew or passengers of such vessel, aircraft or vehicle;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: any document relating to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the carriage of cargo in or on such vessel, aircraft or vehicle; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the inter-office business transactions of the owner of such vessel, aircraft or vehicle;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: articles imported or exported by a passenger of such vessel, aircraft or vehicle, in his personal baggage or carried by him; and (Added 78 of 1979 s. 2)

paragraph.name: f

def.name: CargoTranshipmentAreaOfHongKongInternationalAirport
def.leadIn: cargo transhipment area of Hong Kong International Airport (機場貨物轉運區) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any part of Hong Kong International Airport that is designated under section 35 of the Aviation Security Ordinance (Cap. 494) as a restricted area; and

paragraph.name: b

def.name: Claimant

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who claims to be the owner of an article, vessel or vehicle liable to forfeiture under Part VI;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who is the authorized agent of a person claiming to be the owner of an article, vessel or vehicle liable to forfeiture under Part VI;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: who claims to have a legal or equitable interest in an article, vessel or vehicle liable to forfeiture under Part VI,

def.continued: and who makes a claim or petitions under that Part; (Added 62 of 1993 s. 2)

section.def: commander (機長) means, in respect of an aircraft, the member of the flight crew designated as commander of the aircraft by the operator thereof or, if no member of the flight crew is so designated, the person for the time being in command of the aircraft;
Commissioner (關長) means the Commissioner of Customs and Excise and any Deputy or Assistant Commissioner of Customs and Excise; (Added L.N. 294 of 1982. Amended 66 of 2000 s. 3)
consign (托運) means to deliver or transmit an article into the custody of a person for the purpose of delivery or transmission of the article by that person to another specified person;
contraband (違禁品) means an article which is exported, imported or otherwise dealt with contrary to the provisions of this Ordinance or any other law controlling the import or export of any article;
court (法庭、法院) includes a magistrate; (Added 1 of 1994 s. 2)

Director (署長) means the Director-General of Trade and Industry and, except where the expression “Director-General of Trade and Industry” (工業貿易署署長) is used, any Deputy or Assistant Director-General of Trade and Industry; (Replaced L.N. 294 of 1982. Amended L.N. 292 of 1989; L.N. 173 of 2000)
domestic premises (住用處所) means any premises or place used exclusively for residential purposes and constituting a separate household unit;
electronic record (電子紀錄) has the meaning given to that term by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553); (Added 24 of 2002 s. 2)
Hong Kong International Airport (香港國際機場) means the airport referred to in section 5(1)(a) of the Airport Authority Ordinance (Cap. 483); (Added 29 of 2000 s. 2)
information (資料) has the meaning given to that term by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553); (Added 24 of 2002 s. 2)
information system (資訊系統) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553); (Added 30 of 2025 s. 3)

licence (許可證) means a licence, certificate, authorization or permit issued under the provisions of this Ordinance and includes a licence issued under this Ordinance which is sent to the licensee using the specified system; (Amended 30 of 1995 s. 2; 30 of 2025 s. 3)

manifest (艙單) means a record prepared as a manifest containing the particulars prescribed under section 17 but does not include any record, containing the same or similar particulars, which is not specifically prepared as a manifest; (Replaced 62 of 1993 s. 2. Amended 24 of 2002 s. 2)
member of the Customs and Excise Service (海關人員) means any person holding an office specified in Schedule 1 to the Customs and Excise Service Ordinance (Cap. 342); (Amended 1 of 1994 s. 2)

def.name: Owner
def.leadIn: owner (擁有人) means, other than for the purposes of Part VI—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of an article, any person being or holding himself out to be the owner, importer, exporter, consignee, agent or person in possession of, or beneficially interested in, or having any control of, or power of disposition over, the article; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of a vessel, aircraft or vehicle—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the registered owner and any person holding himself out to be the owner thereof;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any person acting as agent for the owner in connexion with the handling of cargo carried in or on the vessel, aircraft or vehicle;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any person to whom the vessel, aircraft or vehicle has been chartered or hired; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: any person having for the time being the control or management of the vessel, aircraft or vehicle;

section.def: production notification (生產通知書) means a notification required to be lodged under section 6AB(1); (Added 37 of 1999 s. 2)

def.name: ProhibitedArticle
def.leadIn: prohibited article (禁運物品) means any article—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the import or export of which is prohibited under the provisions of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the import or export of which is permitted subject to the terms and conditions of a licence; or

paragraph.name: c
a
paragraph.content: in relation to a production notification, means the reference number assigned to the notification under section 6AB(2)(d);

paragraph.name: b

section.def: security device (保安裝置) means a device issued to a person to be used for authenticating that person as the sender of information using services provided by a specified body; (Added 30 of 1995 s. 2. Amended 24 of 2002 s. 2)

services provided by a specified body (指明團體所提供的服務) means information technology services for the transmission of information to and from the Commissioner or the Director under this Ordinance, provided by a specified body; (Added 30 of 1995 s. 2)

smuggling (走私) means importing, exporting, unshipping, shipping, landing, loading, carrying, conveying or otherwise dealing with any article contrary to the provisions of this Ordinance or any other law controlling the import or export of any article; (Amended 22 of 1991 s. 3)
specified agent (指明代理人) means a body specified in Schedule 3; (Added 30 of 1995 s. 2)
specified body (指明團體) means a body specified in Schedule 2; (Added 30 of 1995 s. 2)
specified system (指明系統) means an information system specified in Schedule 4; (Added 30 of 2025 s. 3)

def.name: TranshipmentCargo
def.leadIn: transhipment cargo (轉運貨物) means any imported article that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is consigned on a through bill of lading or a through air waybill from a place outside Hong Kong to another place outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is or is to be removed from the vessel, aircraft or vehicle in which it was imported and either returned to the same vessel, aircraft or vehicle or transferred to another vessel, aircraft or vehicle before being exported, whether it is or is to be transferred directly between such vessels, aircraft or vehicles or whether it is to be landed in Hong Kong after its importation and stored, pending exportation; (Added 29 of 2000 s. 2)

section.def: transmit (傳送), in relation to any information, includes send, deliver, give, lodge, submit and furnish the information; (Added 30 of 2025 s. 3)
unmanifested cargo (未列艙單貨物) means any cargo which is not recorded in a manifest;
validated production notification (認可生產通知書) means a production notification validated under section 6AC(1); (Added 37 of 1999 s. 2)

vehicle (車輛) means every means of conveyance or of transit or other mobile apparatus used or capable of being used on land, whether on roads or rails and, in any way whatever, drawn or propelled or carried;

vessel (船隻) includes every description of vessel used in navigation for the carriage of persons or articles, whether or not the vessel is mechanically propelled and whether or not the vessel is towed or pushed by another vessel.

section.name: s2AA
section.heading: Approval of part of Airport Area as cargo transhipment area

subsection.content: The Commissioner of Customs and Excise may, after consultation with the Airport Authority, by notice published in the Gazette approve any area within the area specified as the Airport Area pursuant to section 37 of the Airport Authority Ordinance (Cap. 483) to be a part of the cargo transhipment area of Hong Kong International Airport.
A notice published under subsection (1) is not subsidiary legislation for the purposes of section 34 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Application of this Ordinance to Ozone Layer Protection Ordinance
section.leadIn: In applying the following provisions of this Ordinance to anything in respect of which a licence may be issued or the import or export of which is prohibited, under the Ozone Layer Protection Ordinance (Cap. 403)— (Amended 26 of 1993 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in sections 20, 21, 33, 34 and 36 a reference to “licence” is a reference to a licence issued under the Ozone Layer Protection Ordinance (Cap. 403); (Amended 33 of 2003 s. 2)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: in sections 8 and 9 a reference to “import licence” or “licence” is a reference to an import licence or an import and export licence issued under the Ozone Layer Protection Ordinance (Cap. 403); (Added 33 of 2003 s. 2)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: in section 11 a reference to “export licence” or “licence” is a reference to an export licence or an import and export licence issued under the Ozone Layer Protection Ordinance (Cap. 403); (Added 33 of 2003 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in sections 8, 9, 11 and 36(1)(b) a reference to “Ordinance” is a reference to the Ozone Layer Protection Ordinance (Cap. 403); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in sections 5, 20 (except the first reference in subsection (1)(a)), 20A, 21, 23 to 28, 33, 34, 36(1)(c) and 37 a reference to “Ordinance” includes a reference to the Ozone Layer Protection Ordinance (Cap. 403).

part.name: P1A
part.heading: Special Provisions for Using Services Provided by a Specified Body

section.name: s2B
section.heading: Presumption regarding information sent using services provided by specified body

subsection.leadIn: Where information received by the Commissioner or the Director was sent using services provided by a specified body, evidence which shows that the identity of the sender of the information was authenticated by the use of a security device is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: proof that the person issued with the security device furnished the information; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proof that the person issued with the security device made a statement or declaration contained in the information.

subsection.leadIn: Where information received by the Commissioner or the Director and sent using services provided by a specified body was sent by a specified agent who has obtained an authorization in accordance with section 2D—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person named in the information as the person who furnished the information is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, regarded for the purposes of this Ordinance as the person who furnished the information; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person named in the information as the person who made a statement or declaration contained in the information is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, regarded for the purposes of this Ordinance as the person who made the statement or declaration.

section.name: s2C
section.heading: Safekeeping of security device
section.leadIn: A person who has been issued with a security device—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not authorize or allow any other person to use the device in connection with the sending of information to the Commissioner or the Director under this Ordinance using services provided by a specified body;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall take all reasonable steps and exercise due diligence to prevent any other person from using the device in connection with the sending of information to the Commissioner or the Director under this Ordinance using services provided by a specified body.

section.name: s2D
section.heading: Duty of specified agent
section.content: A specified agent shall not send any information on behalf of a person using services provided by a specified body unless the specified agent has obtained from the person an authorization in writing to do so.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Director’s discretion to issue, cancel, revoke or suspend licences

subsection.content: The Director may issue any licence required under this Ordinance and may attach thereto such conditions as he may see fit to impose.
Subject to subsection (3) the Director may cancel, revoke or suspend any licence issued by him under this Ordinance.

The Director shall not cancel, revoke or suspend any such licence where he is satisfied that the holder thereof has entered into an irrevocable commitment pursuant to the issue to him of such licence, unless the article in respect of which the licence was issued is a strategic commodity specified in regulations made under this Ordinance and it is, in the opinion of the Director, necessary for him to cancel, revoke or suspend the licence in the public interest.

Notwithstanding subsection (3), if the Director is satisfied that any licence was issued by him as the result of fraudulent misrepresentation of any fact or any other unlawful act by the applicant therefor he may, at any time, cancel, revoke or suspend the licence.

Every licence issued on paper which has been cancelled, revoked or suspended by the Director and all copies thereof in the possession of the licensee or any other person shall be surrendered immediately to the Director by the licensee. (Amended 30 of 1995 s. 4)
Any person who contravenes subsection (5) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 3 months. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: The Director may serve notice of the cancellation, revocation or suspension of any licence on the holder thereof and such person shall be deemed to be served with the notice if it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is delivered to the holder or applicant personally; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is addressed to him and left at or forwarded by registered mail to him at his usual or last known place of abode or business; or (Amended 30 of 1995 s. 4)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is sent to him using the specified system. (Added 30 of 1995 s. 4. Amended 30 of 2025 s. 5)

subsection.content: Except where the form of a licence is, under the provisions of this Ordinance, required to be prescribed, the Director may determine the form of any licence and of any application therefor and may also determine the requirements for making any application for a licence. (Amended 30 of 1995 s. 4)
The Director may delegate any of the powers and duties conferred or imposed on him by this section to any appointed officer. (Amended L.N. 294 of 1982)

section.name: s4
section.heading: Power of Commissioner to appoint authorized officers
section.content: The Commissioner may authorize in writing any person approved by the Secretary for Security, any police officer and any other public officer to exercise any of the powers and perform any of the duties conferred or imposed on an authorized officer by this Ordinance.

section.name: s4A
section.heading: Appointed officers
section.content: The Director may appoint in writing any public officer to exercise any of the powers and perform any of the duties conferred or imposed on an appointed officer by this Ordinance.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Commissioner or Director and other public officers to be subject to the Chief Executive’s directions

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may give such directions as he thinks fit, either generally or in any particular case, with respect to the exercise or performance by the Commissioner or the Director or any other public officer, other than a judge, a District Judge or a magistrate, of any powers, functions or duties under this Ordinance.

The Commissioner or the Director and every public officer shall, in the exercise or performance of any powers, functions or duties under this Ordinance, comply with any directions given by the Chief Executive under subsection (1).

section.name: s6
section.heading: Appeals to the Chief Executive

subsection.content: Any person aggrieved by a decision, act or omission of the Commissioner or the Director or of any other public officer, other than a judge, a District Judge or a magistrate, taken, done or made in the exercise of any powers or the performance of any duties under this Ordinance may, within 14 days from the date when he was informed of the decision, act or omission or when the decision, act or omission became known to him (whichever is the later) or within such further period as the Chief Executive may allow in any particular case, by notice in writing lodge an objection to the decision, act or omission with the Chief Secretary for Administration. (Amended L.N. 294 of 1982; L.N. 362 of 1997)

On consideration of an objection lodged in accordance with subsection (1), the Chief Executive may confirm, vary or reverse the decision, act or omission of the Commissioner or the Director or other public officer, or substitute therefor such other decision or make such other order as he may think fit. (Amended L.N. 294 of 1982)
Nothing in this section shall entitle any person to lodge an objection under this section to any decision, act or omission of the Chief Executive or of any court.

part.name: P2A
part.heading: Production Notification of Certain Textiles for Export

section.name: s6AA
section.heading: Definitions and application of this Part

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: issue (發出、發給), in relation to any document, includes issue in a manner specified by the Director by notice published in the Gazette; (Amended 30 of 2025 s. 6)

def.name: MaterialParticular
def.leadIn: material particular (要項), in relation to a production notification, means a particular—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: required under section 6AB(2) to be included in the notification; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribed by the regulations as material for the purposes of this definition;

subsection.def: permitted period (准許期間) means the period prescribed by the regulations for the purposes of this definition;
production (生產), in relation to any specified textiles, means the process of manufacturing those textiles as prescribed by the regulations for the purposes of this definition;
specified textiles (指明紡織品) means any textiles prescribed by the regulations for the purposes of this definition; (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

section.def: the regulations (規例) means the regulations made under section 31. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

subsection.content: This Part shall not apply to specified textiles except specified textiles that are produced for export to a country or place prescribed by the regulations for the purposes of this section.
The regulations may make provision for the purposes of exempting from this Part any specified textiles to which this Part would otherwise apply.

A reference number of a production notification or validated production notification may be assigned in a manner specified by the Director by notice published in the Gazette. (Amended 30 of 2025 s. 6)

section.name: s6AB
section.heading: Lodging of production notification

subsection.content: A person shall not commence the production of any specified textiles (whether by himself or through any other person) unless he lodges with the Director a notification in respect of those textiles within the permitted period, or within such other period as the Director may, at his discretion, allow in a particular case.

subsection.leadIn: A production notification shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in such form and include such particulars and declarations as the Director may specify;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be lodged with the Director on paper or in a manner specified by the Director by notice published in the Gazette; (Amended 30 of 2025 s. 7)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be lodged in accordance with such other requirements, and attach or contain such other information, as the Director may determine; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be assigned a reference number by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: If there is any change in a material particular included in a production notification lodged by a person under subsection (1), the person shall inform the Director of the change by notice in writing or in a manner specified by the Director by notice published in the Gazette— (Amended 30 of 2025 s. 7)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: immediately if the notification is not a validated production notification;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the notification is a validated production notification, within 14 days of the change but, in any case, before applying for a licence in respect of the specified textiles to which the notification relates.

subsection.leadIn: Where but for this subsection a person would be required to comply with subsection (1) in relation to any textiles, then the person is not required to comply with that subsection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the person complies with an undertaking given—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in relation to the textiles; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: under regulation 8(3) of the Export (Certificates of Origin) Regulations (Cap. 60 sub. leg. H) and that is comparable to the requirement of subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: until the expiration of 30 days after the commencement* of this section.

subsection.content: A person does not have to comply with the undertaking referred to in subsection (4)(a) in relation to any textiles on and after the day on which the person complies or is required to comply with subsection (1) in relation to the textiles, and, accordingly, regulation 12(2)(c) of the Export (Certificates of Origin) Regulations (Cap. 60 sub. leg. H) does not apply to the undertaking to the extent the undertaking relates to the textiles.

section.name: s6AC
section.heading: Validation of production notification

subsection.leadIn: The Director shall validate a production notification if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it complies with section 6AB(2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Director is satisfied that the person who lodged the notification—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has complied or will comply with the declarations made in the notification; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is or will be capable of complying with the conditions, if any, that the Director is minded to impose under section 6AD(1) on the notification.

subsection.content: The Director shall validate a production notification by assigning to the notification a reference number and endorsing that number on the notification.
The Director shall issue a validated production notification to the person who lodged the notification with the Director.
The Director may require an application for a licence in respect of any specified textiles to be supported by a validated production notification relating to those textiles.

section.name: s6AD
section.heading: Director’s discretion in respect of validated production notifications

subsection.content: The Director may issue a validated production notification subject to such conditions specified or referred to in the notification as he may see fit to impose.
The Director may cancel a validated production notification at the request of its holder.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may revoke or suspend a validated production notification if it appears to him that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a condition imposed on, or a declaration made in, the notification has not been complied with; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: false or misleading information has been given in connection with the validated production notification.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may serve notice of the cancellation, revocation or suspension of a validated production notification on its holder and such holder shall, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, be deemed to be served with the notice if it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is delivered to the holder personally, or in the case of a partnership, to a person apparently concerned with the management of, or apparently employed by, the partnership;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is addressed to the holder and left at or forwarded by registered mail to him at his usual or last known place of abode or business; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is sent to the holder in a manner specified by the Director by notice published in the Gazette. (Amended 30 of 2025 s. 8)

subsection.content: The holder of a validated production notification that has been cancelled, revoked or suspended shall immediately surrender to the Director the validated production notification and all its copies issued to him by the Director.

No person shall use a validated production notification that has been cancelled, revoked or suspended, or quote its reference number, for any purpose in connection with the export of the specified textiles to which the notification relates.
A person who contravenes subsection (5) or (6) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 3 months.
The Director may delegate any of the powers and duties conferred or imposed on him by this Part to any appointed officer.

section.name: s6AE
section.heading: Certain notices are not subsidiary legislation
section.content: A notice under section 6AA(1) or (4), 6AB(2)(b) or (3) or 6AD(4)(c) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s6A
section.heading: Restriction on import and export of strategic commodities

subsection.def: In this section and section 6B, Regulations (規例) means the Import and Export (Strategic Commodities) Regulations (Cap. 60 sub. leg. G).

subsection.leadIn: A person who imports or exports an article specified in Schedule 1 to the Regulations except under and in accordance with an import or export licence issued by the Director commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to an unlimited fine and to imprisonment for 7 years.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an article in transit except an article specified in Schedule 2 to the Regulations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an article of air transhipment cargo, except an article specified in Schedule 2 to the Regulations, which is imported or exported by a person to whom an exemption has been granted under regulation 2A of the Regulations with respect to the transhipment of that article. (Amended 29 of 2000 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: A person who imports or exports an article specified in Schedule 3 to the Regulations or any technological document containing information relating to an article specified in Schedule 3 to the Regulations, except under and in accordance with an import or export licence issued by the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if he knows that the article or document is intended or likely to be used in an activity specified in Schedule 4 to the Regulations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there are reasonable grounds for him to believe that the article or document may be used in such an activity,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to an unlimited fine and to imprisonment for 7 years.

subsection.content: It is a defence to a charge under subsection (4)(b) for the person charged to prove that he made all reasonable enquiries as to the intended use of the article or document and satisfied himself that it would not be used for an activity specified in Schedule 4 to the Regulations.

section.name: s6B
section.heading: Orders made by Director for purposes of section 6A, etc.

subsection.content: The Director may by order replace the Schedules to the Regulations or amend them to add or remove an article or class of articles to or from the Schedules or may by order add or remove an activity specified in Schedule 4 to the Regulations.
The Director shall publish an order under subsection (1) in the Gazette and shall cause it to be laid on the table of the Legislative Council at the next sitting day after it is published.
The Legislative Council may, within the period of 28 days after the date it is laid, by resolution, repeal the order. (Amended 1 of 1994 s. 4)

If the period of 28 days would, but for this subsection, expire after the end of a session or a dissolution of the Legislative Council and before the second sitting day in the next session, that period shall be extended and shall expire on the day after the second sitting day.

subsection.leadIn: Before the expiry of the period referred to in subsection (3) or that period as extended by virtue of subsection (4), the Legislative Council may by resolution in relation to an order specified therein—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of the period referred to in subsection (3), extend that period to the first sitting of the Legislative Council held not earlier than the twenty-first day after the day of its expiry;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case where the period referred to in subsection (3) has been extended by virtue of subsection (4), extend that period as so extended to the first sitting of the Legislative Council held not earlier than the twenty-first day after the day of the second sitting in that next session. (Replaced 8 of 2002 s. 4)

subsection.content: A resolution under subsection (3) or (5) shall be published in the Gazette within 14 days after it is passed or such further period as the Chief Executive may allow. (Amended 66 of 2000 s. 3)

An order under subsection (1) shall come into operation, if the Legislative Council does not, by resolution, repeal the order under this section before the expiry of the period to repeal it, on a day to be appointed by the Director by notice published in the Gazette after the expiry of that period. (Amended 1 of 1994 s. 4)

subsection.def: In this section, sitting (立法會會議), when used to calculate time, means the day on which the sitting commences and only includes a sitting at which subsidiary legislation is included on the order paper. (Added 89 of 1993 s. 30. Amended 66 of 2000 s. 3)

section.name: s6C
section.heading: Restriction on import of certain prohibited articles

subsection.content: Subject to the Import and Export (General) Regulations (Cap. 60 sub. leg. A), no person shall import any article specified in Schedule 1 to those regulations except under and in accordance with an import licence issued under section 3.

Any person who contravenes subsection (1) in respect of any article specified in Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Import and Export (General) Regulations (Cap. 60 sub. leg. A) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who contravenes subsection (1) in respect of any article specified in Part 2 of Schedule 1 to the Import and Export (General) Regulations (Cap. 60 sub. leg. A) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $2,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years.

section.name: s6D
section.heading: Restriction on export of certain prohibited articles

subsection.content: Subject to the Import and Export (General) Regulations (Cap. 60 sub. leg. A), no person shall export any article specified in the second column of Schedule 2 to those regulations to the country or place specified opposite thereto in the third column of that Schedule except under and in accordance with an export licence issued under section 3.

Subject to the Export (Prescribed Articles) Regulations (Cap. 60 sub. leg. D), no person shall export any article prescribed in the Schedule to those regulations on or by a vessel of less than 250 gross tons except under and in accordance with an export licence issued under section 3.

Any person who contravenes subsection (1) in respect of any article specified in the second column of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Import and Export (General) Regulations (Cap. 60 sub. leg. A) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who contravenes subsection (1) in respect of any article specified in the second column of Part 2 of Schedule 2 to the Import and Export (General) Regulations (Cap. 60 sub. leg. A), or subsection (2), shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $2,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years.

section.name: s6E
section.heading: Restriction on carriage, etc. of prescribed articles in Hong Kong waters

subsection.content: A person shall not, without lawful excuse, place on board, or cause to be placed on board, or possess on board, a vessel within the waters of Hong Kong a prescribed article.
The owner of a vessel within the waters of Hong Kong shall not permit a prescribed article to be placed on board, or carried on, his vessel without lawful excuse.
A person shall not, without lawful excuse, use a vessel to carry on board the vessel, or use a vessel to tow on board another vessel, a prescribed article within the waters of Hong Kong.
A person shall not, without lawful excuse, use a vessel to tow otherwise than on board another vessel a prescribed article within the waters of Hong Kong.

def.name: LawfulExcuse
def.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (1), (2) and (3), lawful excuse (合法辯解) means the article is placed on board, or carried on, or carried or towed by use of, a vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which vessel is of or more than 250 gross tons and the article is for bona fide import or export;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for delivery to a vessel of or more than 250 gross tons within Hong Kong and the article is for bona fide import or export purposes and is accompanied by a shipping document;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: from another vessel within Hong Kong which is of or more than 250 gross tons and the article is for bona fide import or export purposes and is accompanied by a shipping document;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: which is a passenger vessel of or more than 250 gross tons other than a ferry vessel;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: which is a ferry vessel as defined in regulation 2 of the Shipping and Port Control (Ferry Terminals) Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. H), or as defined in section 2 of the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Ferry Terminals) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. B), operating between— (Amended 24 of 2005 s. 55)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a terminal in Hong Kong and a place in Macao; or (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 12)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a terminal in Hong Kong and another place in China; (Amended 64 of 1999 s. 3; 66 of 2000 s. 3)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: which is a ferry vessel—

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: permitted by the Commissioner for Transport under the Ferry Services Ordinance (Cap. 104) to ply between 2 or more points within the waters of Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: travelling on a permitted route except a route which includes a stopping point on an island other than Hong Kong Island;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: by a passenger, or as part of his baggage, for his own use other than for trade or business, which vessel is a ferry vessel—

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: permitted by the Commissioner for Transport under the Ferry Services Ordinance (Cap. 104) to ply between 2 or more points within the waters of Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: travelling on a permitted route;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: by a passenger, or as part of his baggage, for his own use other than for trade or business, which vessel is certificated by the Director of Marine for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: Class I vessel under the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Certification and Licensing) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. D); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: Class II vessel under that Regulation and is permitted to carry passengers under a licence issued under section 15 or 19 of that Regulation; (Replaced 24 of 2005 s. 55)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: under an export licence issued for the purposes of section 6D(2);

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: for the personal use of a crew member or a passenger while he is on board the vessel;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: under a carriage licence issued by the Commissioner under the Import and Export (Carriage of Articles) Regulations (Cap. 60 sub. leg. I),

def.continued: and includes possessing a prescribed article on board the vessel in any of the circumstances set out in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f), (g), (h), (i), (j) or (k).

subsection.def: For the purposes of subsection (4), lawful excuse (合法辯解) means the article is towed by use of a vessel, under a carriage licence issued by the Commissioner under the Import and Export (Carriage of Articles) Regulations (Cap. 60 sub. leg. I).

subsection.leadIn: Any person who contravenes subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $2,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: ferry vessel (渡輪船隻) means a vessel which plies regularly for the carriage of passengers and articles between 2 or more points within the waters of Hong Kong;
prescribed article (訂明物品) means an article prescribed in the Schedule to the Import and Export (Carriage of Articles) Regulations (Cap. 60 sub. leg. I);
shipping company (航運公司) means a company that carries on the business of transporting articles or arranging transport of articles for import or export purposes;

def.name: ShippingDocument
def.leadIn: shipping document (裝運單據) means a document issued by a shipping company or its agent in Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: authorizing the delivery in Hong Kong of imported articles; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: instructing the master of a vessel in Hong Kong to accept and export articles out of Hong Kong.

section.name: s6F
section.heading: Orders made by Director for purposes of sections 6C to 6E, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may by order amend—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Part 2 of Schedule 1 or 2 to the Import and Export (General) Regulations (Cap. 60 sub. leg. A);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Schedule to the Export (Prescribed Articles) Regulations (Cap. 60 sub. leg. D);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Schedule to the Import and Export (Carriage of Articles) Regulations (Cap. 60 sub. leg. I).

subsection.content: The Director shall publish an order under subsection (1) in the Gazette and shall cause it to be laid on the table of the Legislative Council at the next sitting day after it is published.
The Legislative Council may, within the period of 28 days after the date an order under subsection (1) is laid, by resolution, amend the order in any manner consistent with this section.

If the period of 28 days would, but for this subsection, expire after the end of a session or a dissolution of the Legislative Council and before the second sitting day in the next session, that period shall be extended and shall expire on the day after the second sitting day.

subsection.leadIn: Before the expiry of the period referred to in subsection (3) or that period as extended by virtue of subsection (4), the Legislative Council may by resolution in relation to an order specified therein—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of the period referred to in subsection (3), extend that period to the first sitting of the Legislative Council held not earlier than the twenty-first day after the day of its expiry;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case where the period referred to in subsection (3) has been extended by virtue of subsection (4), extend that period as so extended to the first sitting of the Legislative Council held not earlier than the twenty-first day after the day of the second sitting in that next session. (Replaced 8 of 2002 s. 5)

subsection.content: A resolution under subsection (3) or (5) shall be published in the Gazette within 14 days after it is passed or such further period as the Chief Executive may allow. (Amended 66 of 2000 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: An order under subsection (1) shall come into operation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the Legislative Council does not, by resolution, amend the order under this section before the expiry of the period to amend it, on a day to be appointed by the Director by notice published in the Gazette after the expiry of that period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Legislative Council, by resolution, amends the order under this section, as from the date of publication in the Gazette under subsection (6) of the resolution.

subsection.def: In this section, sitting (立法會會議), when used to calculate time, means the day on which the sitting commences and only includes a sitting at which subsidiary legislation is included on the order paper. (Amended 66 of 2000 s. 3)

section.name: s7
section.heading: Possession of prohibited article after import

subsection.leadIn: The owner of any vessel, aircraft or vehicle in or on which any prohibited article is imported (conveyance owner) must retain possession of the prohibited article until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the import of the prohibited article is permitted subject to the terms and conditions of a licence—

subparagraph.content: the conveyance owner has obtained, using the specified system, an import licence issued under this Ordinance or some other law in respect of the prohibited article; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case—the Commissioner gives to the conveyance owner written directions in respect of the removal or storage of the prohibited article. (Replaced 30 of 2025 s. 10)

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes this section shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year. (Amended 60 of 1980 s. 2)

It shall be a defence to a charge under subsection (1)(a) if the defendant proves that he did not know and could not with reasonable diligence have known that the article to which the charge relates was a prohibited article.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Delivery of import licence and manifest to Director etc.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 9, a person to whom an import licence has been issued under this Ordinance in respect of an article must, within 7 days after the day on which the article was imported—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: present the licence to the owner of the vessel, aircraft or vehicle in or on which the article was imported (conveyance owner);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: send, using the specified system, the licence to the conveyance owner; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: otherwise enable the conveyance owner to obtain, using the specified system, the licence. (Replaced 30 of 2025 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: On obtaining the licence under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the conveyance owner may release the article to the consignee if the owner is satisfied that the owner is not prohibited from doing so under the conditions of the licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the conveyance owner must, within 7 days after the day on which the licence was obtained—

subparagraph.content: deliver to the Director, using the specified system, a copy or extract of the manifest of the vessel, aircraft or vehicle in or on which the article was imported. (Replaced 30 of 2025 s. 11)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The conveyance owner is taken to have complied with the requirement under subsection (2)(b)(ii) if, at the time of delivering the licence or informing the Director of the licence number (if applicable) under subsection (2)(b)(i), the manifest has been lodged using the specified system with the Commissioner, or with an officer appointed by the Commissioner, under regulation 11 of the Import and Export (Registration) Regulations (Cap. 60 sub. leg. E). (Replaced 30 of 2025 s. 11)
Any person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 2. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

section.name: s9
section.heading: Delivery of import licence and manifest in the case of part shipments

subsection.leadIn: If an article which is imported forms part only of a consignment of articles in respect of which an import licence has been issued under this Ordinance, the person to whom the licence was issued shall present—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the import licence endorsed by him to this effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a written declaration signed by him stating that the article which has been imported forms part only of a consignment of articles in respect of which the licence was issued,

subsection.continued: to the owner of the vessel, aircraft or vehicle in or on which the article was imported within 7 days after the article was imported.

subsection.leadIn: The owner of the vessel, aircraft or vehicle, on receiving from a licensee an endorsed import licence and written declaration pursuant to subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: shall, within 7 days after receiving the import licence and written declaration—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: endorse the licence and return it to the person to whom it was issued; (Replaced 24 of 2002 s. 2)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: deliver the declaration to the Director; and (Replaced 24 of 2002 s. 2)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: deliver to the Director, using the specified system, a copy or extract of the manifest of the vessel, aircraft or vehicle in or on which the article was imported. (Added 24 of 2002 s. 2. Amended 30 of 2025 s. 12)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The owner of the vessel, aircraft or vehicle is taken to have complied with the requirement under subsection (2)(b)(iii) if, at the time of delivering the declaration under subsection (2)(b)(ii), the manifest has been lodged using the specified system with the Commissioner, or with an officer appointed by the Commissioner, under regulation 11 of the Import and Export (Registration) Regulations (Cap. 60 sub. leg. E). (Replaced 30 of 2025 s. 12)
The written declaration referred to in subsections (1) and (2) shall be made in such form as the Director may specify from time to time.
Any person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 2. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

section.name: s10
section.heading: Carriers prohibited from accepting prohibited articles for export without licence

subsection.leadIn: The owner of a vessel, aircraft or vehicle shall not accept any prohibited article for export on the vessel, aircraft or vehicle until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an export licence issued under this Ordinance or some other law in respect of the prohibited article is presented to the owner; or (Replaced 30 of 2025 s. 13)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the owner has obtained, using the specified system, an export licence issued under this Ordinance or some other law in respect of the prohibited article. (Replaced 30 of 2025 s. 13)

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes this section shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year. (Amended 60 of 1980 s. 3)

It shall be a defence to a charge under this section if the defendant proves that he did not know and could not with reasonable diligence have known that the article to which the charge relates was a prohibited article.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Delivery of export licence and manifest to Director etc.

subsection.leadIn: An owner of an article to whom a licence has been issued under this Ordinance for the export of the article must, before the article is exported—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: send, using the specified system, the licence to the conveyance owner; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: otherwise enable the conveyance owner to obtain, using the specified system, the licence. (Replaced 30 of 2025 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: On obtaining the licence under subsection (1), the conveyance owner must, within 14 days after the day on which the article was exported—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: deliver to the Director, using the specified system, a copy or extract of the manifest of the vessel, aircraft or vehicle in or on which the article was exported. (Replaced 30 of 2025 s. 14)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The conveyance owner is taken to have complied with the requirement under subsection (2)(b) if, at the time of delivering the licence or informing the Director of the licence number (if applicable) under subsection (2)(a), the manifest has been lodged using the specified system with the Commissioner, or with an officer appointed by the Commissioner, under regulation 12 of the Import and Export (Registration) Regulations (Cap. 60 sub. leg. E). (Replaced 30 of 2025 s. 14)
Any person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 2. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

section.name: s11A
section.heading: Director to have access to manifests lodged with Commissioner
section.content: The Director shall have access to any information contained in a manifest of cargo that has been lodged under this Ordinance with the Commissioner or with an officer appointed by the Commissioner.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Inspection and storage of prohibited articles

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of determining whether or not an article which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been imported within the period of 6 months preceding the date when a request is made under this subsection for the production of the same; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is intended to be exported,

subsection.continued: is a prohibited article, the person in possession or control of article shall, if required to do so by the Commissioner, an authorized officer or member of the Customs and Excise Service of or above the rank of Inspector, produce it for inspection by the Commissioner, an authorized officer or such member of the Customs and Excise Service. (Amended 46 of 1977 s. 17; 62 of 1993 s. 4)

subsection.content: The Commissioner, any authorized officer or a member of the Customs and Excise Service of or above the rank of Inspector shall determine whether or not any article produced to him for inspection under subsection (1) is a prohibited article. (Amended 46 of 1977 s. 17; 62 of 1993 s. 4)

The person in possession or control of a prohibited article shall, if required to do so by the Commissioner or an authorized officer, cause such article to be stored in a place specified by the Commissioner or authorized officer under such conditions as he may impose.

An article stored in a specified place in accordance with the directions of the Commissioner or authorized officer under subsection (3) shall not be removed from that place unless the Commissioner or an authorized officer has authorized in writing the removal of the article.

Any person authorized in writing under subsection (4) to remove an article from a specified place shall comply with such conditions as may be imposed by the Commissioner or authorized officer on the removal of the article.

Any person who contravenes subsection (1), (3), (4) or (5) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

section.name: s13
section.heading: Claim and disposal of prohibited articles found without owner

subsection.content: The Commissioner or any authorized officer may order that any prohibited article which is found without an apparent owner shall be stored in a place specified by him subject to such conditions as he may impose.

Any person who, being in possession of a prohibited article which is found without an apparent owner, fails to comply with an order given by the Commissioner or an authorized officer under subsection (1) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: Where a prohibited article is stored in a specified place pursuant to an order given under subsection (1), the Commissioner or an authorized officer shall, within the period of 72 hours after the prohibited article has been stored in that place, cause a notice to be exhibited at the Customs and Excise Department in a place to which the public have access—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stating that the prohibited article has been stored in that place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: calling upon the owner of the prohibited article to submit to the Commissioner a claim in respect of it within 30 days; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: stating his intention to apply to a magistrate at the expiration of 30 days from the date of the notice for an order that the prohibited article be forfeited to the Government. (Amended 66 of 2000 s. 3)

subsection.content: When a claim to ownership of a prohibited article is submitted to the Commissioner pursuant to a notice given under subsection (3), the person who has made a claim shall produce to the Commissioner or an authorized officer such evidence as to his ownership as may be required by the Commissioner or authorized officer. (Amended 62 of 1993 s. 5)

Without prejudice to any provision of this Ordinance relating to the seizure of any article which is liable to forfeiture, the Commissioner or an authorized officer may, if he is satisfied of the validity of a claim made under subsection (4), authorize in writing the person who has made a claim to remove the prohibited article from the place in which it was stored, subject to the prior payment by the person who has made a claim of all storage and other charges which have accrued in respect of the storage of the article in the specified place. (Amended 62 of 1993 s. 5)

A magistrate shall, if satisfied that the provisions of this section have been complied with and that no claim to ownership has been established, on the application of the Commissioner or an authorized officer, order that a prohibited article be forfeited to the Government. (Amended 66 of 2000 s. 3)

part.name: P3A
part.heading: Prohibition on Importing Alternative Smoking Products and Exemptions

section.name: s13A
section.heading: Interpretation (Part IIIA)
section.def: specified intermodal transhipment cargo (指明聯運轉運貨物) means an article—(a)imported in a vehicle or vessel; and(b)consigned—(i)on a through bill of lading from a place outside Hong Kong to another place outside Hong Kong; and(ii)for export in an aircraft departing from the Hong Kong International Airport.

division.name: D2
division.heading: General Prohibition on Importing Alternative Smoking Products

section.name: s13B
section.heading: Offence of importing alternative smoking products
section.leadIn: A person who imports an alternative smoking product commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $2,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years.

section.name: s13C
section.heading: Liability of officers of bodies corporate, partners and members of unincorporated bodies

subsection.leadIn: If a body corporate commits an offence under section 13B, and it is proved that the offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was committed with the consent or connivance of a person specified in subsection (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is attributable to any neglect on the part of the person,

subsection.continued: the person also commits the offence.

subsection.leadIn: The person referred to in subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a director, manager, secretary or other similar officer of the body corporate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person purporting to act in the capacity of a person referred to in paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: If a partner in a partnership commits an offence under section 13B, and it is proved that the offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was committed with the consent or connivance of a person specified in subsection (4); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is attributable to any neglect on the part of the person,

subsection.continued: the person also commits the offence.

subsection.leadIn: The person referred to in subsection (3) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any other partner in the partnership or any other person concerned in the management of the partnership; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person purporting to act in the capacity of a person referred to in paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: If a member of any other unincorporated body commits an offence under section 13B, and it is proved that the offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was committed with the consent or connivance of a person specified in subsection (6); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is attributable to any neglect on the part of the person,

subsection.continued: the person also commits the offence.

subsection.leadIn: The person referred to in subsection (5) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any other member, or any manager, secretary or other similar officer, of the unincorporated body; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person purporting to act in the capacity of a person referred to in paragraph (a).

division.name: D3
division.heading: Exemptions from Prohibition on Importing Alternative Smoking Products and Related Matters

subdivision.name: SD1
subdivision.heading: Articles in Transit and Certain Transhipment Cargoes

section.name: s13D
section.heading: Interpretation (Subdivision 1)

subsection.leadIn: In this Subdivision—
subsection.def: practice guidelines (實務指引) means the guidelines issued under section 13H(1);
registered operator (登記營運人) means a person in respect of whom a registration under section 13G has effect.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Subdivision—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a vehicle is a person’s business vehicle if the person imports any article in the vehicle as a registered operator; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a vessel is a person’s business vessel if the person imports any article in the vessel as a registered operator.

section.name: s13E
section.heading: Exemption for articles in transit and certain transhipment cargoes

subsection.leadIn: Section 13B does not apply in relation to an alternative smoking product that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an article in transit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an air transhipment cargo; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a specified intermodal transhipment cargo imported by a registered operator.

subsection.leadIn: However, section 13B does apply in relation to an alternative smoking product mentioned in subsection (1) if, at any time between its being brought into and taken out of Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: for an article in transit in a vessel—the product is removed from the vessel;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for an air transhipment cargo—the product is removed from the cargo transhipment area of Hong Kong International Airport; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: for a specified intermodal transhipment cargo—

subparagraph.content: if the product has not entered the cargo transhipment area of Hong Kong International Airport or an area specified under section 13I(1) (each a specified area)—the product is removed from the vehicle or vessel in which it is imported; or
if the product has entered a specified area—the product is removed from that area.

subsection.leadIn: If section 13B applies in relation to a product because of subsection (2), for the purposes of the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the product is deemed to be imported at the time of the removal mentioned in that subsection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person who brought the product, or caused it to be brought, into Hong Kong as an article in transit, air transhipment cargo or specified intermodal transhipment cargo is deemed to be the person who imported the product.

section.name: s13F
section.heading: Defence related to import of alternative smoking products deemed under section 13E

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person mentioned in section 13E(3)(b) who is charged under section 13B to show that the person took all reasonable steps and exercised reasonable diligence to avoid the removal mentioned in section 13E(2).

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) applies if a defence under subsection (1) involves an allegation that the offence was committed because of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: another person’s act or default; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the defendant’s reliance on information given by another person.

subsection.leadIn: Without the leave of the court, the defendant may not rely on the defence unless, at least 10 days before the hearing of the proceedings, the defendant has served a written notice on the prosecutor giving particulars of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person who allegedly committed the act or default, or allegedly gave the information; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the act, default or information concerned,

subsection.continued: of which the defendant is aware at the time the notice is served.

subsection.leadIn: The defendant may not rely on a defence under subsection (1) claiming that the offence was committed because of the defendant’s reliance on information given by another person unless the defendant shows that the reliance was reasonable in all the circumstances, having regard in particular to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the steps that the defendant took, and those which might reasonably have been taken, for verifying the information; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the defendant had any reason to disbelieve the information.

section.name: s13G
section.heading: Import of specified intermodal transhipment cargoes: registration as registered operator

subsection.content: A person who intends to import any articles in reliance on an exemption under section 13E(1)(c) may, in accordance with the practice guidelines and in the form specified under subsection (9), apply to the Commissioner for registration as a registered operator.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: approve an application made under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse the application.

subsection.leadIn: After determining an application made under subsection (1), the Commissioner must, as soon as practicable, inform the applicant in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the application is approved—

subparagraph.content: the approval; and
the date on which the registration is to take effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the application is refused—

subparagraph.content: the refusal; and
the reasons for the refusal.

subsection.leadIn: If the Commissioner is satisfied that a person is no longer fit to be a registered operator, the Commissioner may by written notice given to the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cancel the registration; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: suspend the registration.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4)(b), the Commissioner may—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: impose any terms or conditions the Commissioner considers appropriate so that a registration suspended under that subsection has no effect until the Commissioner is satisfied that the terms or conditions are complied with.

subsection.leadIn: If the Commissioner decides to cancel or suspend under subsection (4) a person’s registration, the Commissioner must, as soon as practicable after so deciding, inform the person in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the registration is cancelled—

subparagraph.content: the cancellation;
the reasons for the cancellation; and
the date on which the cancellation is to take effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the registration is suspended—

subparagraph.content: the suspension;
the reasons for the suspension; and
the period, or terms or conditions, mentioned in subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in considering an application made by a person under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in considering for the purposes of subsection (4) whether a person is no longer fit to be a registered operator,

subsection.continued: may have regard to any matters that the Commissioner considers relevant, including whether the person has contravened any practice guidelines.

subsection.leadIn: For determining for the purposes of subsection (7) whether a person has contravened any practice guidelines, the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may by written notice given to the person require the person to provide any information that is specified in the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may at any reasonable time inspect any vehicle or vessel that the person intends to use as a business vehicle or business vessel.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may specify the form required for the purposes of this section.

section.name: s13H
section.heading: Import of specified intermodal transhipment cargoes: issue of guidelines

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may issue guidelines setting out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the manner in which an application under section 13G(1) must be made;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the requirements that a registered operator’s business vehicle or business vessel must meet;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the manner in which any articles intended to be imported in reliance on an exemption under section 13E(1)(c) must be transported, stored and otherwise handled before being transferred to an aircraft for export; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other matters that the Commissioner considers relevant to the import of any articles in reliance on that exemption.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must publish the practice guidelines in a manner appropriate to bring them to the notice of persons affected by them; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must make copies of the practice guidelines available to the public (whether in hard copy form or electronic form).

subsection.content: The practice guidelines are not subsidiary legislation.
The Commissioner may amend or revoke any of the practice guidelines.
Subsections (2) and (3) apply to an amendment or revocation of the practice guidelines in the same way as they apply to the practice guidelines.

section.name: s13I
section.heading: Import of specified intermodal transhipment cargoes: area specified for section 13E

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, after consultation with the Airport Authority, by notice published in the Gazette specify an area for the purposes of section 13E(2)(d).
A notice published under subsection (1) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s13J
section.heading: Relationship with Pharmacy and Poisons Ordinance

subsection.content: This Part does not limit the Pharmacy and Poisons Ordinance (Cap. 138).

If an alternative smoking product is registered as a pharmaceutical product under regulation 36 of the Pharmacy and Poisons Regulations (Cap. 138 sub. leg. A), other provisions of this Part do not apply in relation to the product.

section.name: s13K
section.heading: Exemption for persons in transit at Hong Kong International Airport
section.leadIn: Section 13B does not apply to a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: arrives at the Hong Kong International Airport from a place outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: while in Hong Kong, does not pass through any immigration control.

section.name: s13L
section.heading: Exemption for Government Chemists
section.content: Despite section 13B, a Government Chemist (as defined by section 2 of the Evidence Ordinance (Cap. 8)) may import an alternative smoking product so far as it is necessary for the performance of the Government Chemist’s functions.

section.name: s13M
section.heading: Meaning of inspector
section.def: inspector (督察) means a public officer referred to in section 13P.

section.name: s13N
section.heading: Enforcement powers of members of Customs and Excise Service

subsection.content: This section applies to the exclusion of Part V (except sections 20(1)(c)(ii) and (d), 21(2)(c), (d) and (e) and 26) and of section 35.

subsection.leadIn: For the enforcement of section 13B, a member of the Customs and Excise Service—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may stop and search a person, and search anything in the person’s possession;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may stop, board and search any transport carrier;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: may, in the presence of, and under the directions of, an officer of the Post Office, open and examine any postal packet.

subsection.leadIn: A person searched under subsection (2)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may only be searched by a person of the same sex; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may not be searched in a public place if the person objects to being so searched.

subsection.leadIn: A member of the Customs and Excise Service may seize, remove or detain any article if the member reasonably suspects that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the article is an alternative smoking product; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an offence under section 13B has been, is being or is about to be committed in respect of the article.

subsection.leadIn: If a member of the Customs and Excise Service reasonably suspects that a person has committed, is committing or is about to commit an offence under section 13B, the member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to facilitate the enforcement of that section, may detain the person for a reasonable period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may arrest the person without warrant.

subsection.leadIn: A magistrate may issue a warrant empowering a member of the Customs and Excise Service named in the warrant to at any time enter any place that is neither a public place nor a domestic premises if it appears to the magistrate from information on oath that there is reasonable cause for suspecting that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an offence under section 13B has been, is being or is about to be committed in that place; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: anything that is or contains, or that is likely to be or contain, evidence of an offence under section 13B is in that place.

subsection.content: A member of the Customs and Excise Service may use any force reasonably necessary for exercising a power under or pursuant to this section.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: postal packet (郵包) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Post Office Ordinance (Cap. 98);
transport carrier (交通工具) includes an aircraft, vehicle, vessel or train, and any other means of travel or transport.

section.name: s13O
section.heading: Supplementary provisions about enforcement powers of members of Customs and Excise Service

subsection.content: Part VI does not apply to any article seized, removed or detained under section 13N(4).
Such an article may be retained in the custody of a member of the Customs and Excise Service until it is transferred to an inspector for the enforcement of section 13B.

However, if the article is, or a member of the Customs and Excise Service reasonably suspects that it is, a specified intermodal transhipment cargo, subsection (2) also does not apply to the article and, accordingly, section 102 of the Criminal Procedure Ordinance (Cap. 221) applies to the article.

section.name: s13P
section.heading: Inspectors to enforce section 13B

subsection.content: If a public officer is appointed under section 15F of the Smoking (Public Health) Ordinance (Cap. 371)(Cap. 371) to exercise a power and perform a duty, the officer may also exercise a power conferred, and perform a duty imposed, on the officer by section 13Q.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Section 15I of Cap. 371 applies to the exercise of a power and the performance of a duty by virtue of subsection (1) as it applies to the exercise of a power and the performance of a duty conferred or imposed by Cap. 371. (Added 39 of 2025 s. 73)

For the purposes of subsections (1) and (1A), it does not matter whether the appointment is made before, on or after the date on which the Import and Export (Amendment) Ordinance 2023 (16 of 2023) comes into operation*.

section.name: s13Q
section.heading: Enforcement powers of inspectors

subsection.leadIn: An inspector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: may seize, remove or detain any article if the inspector reasonably suspects that—

subparagraph.content: the article is an alternative smoking product; and
an offence under section 13B has been, is being or is about to be committed in respect of the article; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may seize any other thing that appears to the inspector to be evidence of an offence under section 13B.

subsection.leadIn: If an inspector reasonably suspects that a person has committed, is committing or is about to commit an offence under section 13B, the inspector, to facilitate the enforcement of that section— (Amended 39 of 2025 s. 74)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may detain the person for a reasonable period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may search the person and the person’s belongings; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may arrest the person without warrant, and take the person to a police station to be dealt with in accordance with the Police Force Ordinance (Cap. 232). (Amended 39 of 2025 s. 74)

subsection.name: 2A
