subsection.content: If the person resists, or attempts to evade, a search or arrest effected under subsection (2), the inspector may use any force that is reasonably necessary to effect the search or arrest. (Added 39 of 2025 s. 74)

subsection.leadIn: An inspector may do all or any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require any person to give the person’s name and address and to produce proof of identity if the inspector reasonably suspects that the person has committed, is committing or is about to commit an offence under section 13B;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take photographs or make sound or video recording for obtaining evidence in connection with an offence under section 13B;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require any person to produce for inspection documents or records under the control of the person for enabling the inspector to ascertain whether the person has committed, is committing or is about to commit an offence under section 13B;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: make copies of all or any part of the documents or records;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: require any person to provide the inspector with any assistance or information that is reasonably necessary to enable the inspector to exercise a power conferred, or perform a duty imposed, by this section.

subsection.leadIn: A magistrate may issue a warrant empowering an inspector named in the warrant to at any time enter any place that is neither a public place nor a domestic premises if it appears to the magistrate from information on oath that there is reasonable cause for suspecting that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an offence under section 13B has been, is being or is about to be committed in that place; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: anything that is or contains, or that is likely to be or contain, evidence of an offence under section 13B is in that place.

subsection.content: In exercising a power under subsection (1), (2) or (3), or under a warrant mentioned in subsection (4), an inspector must, if requested, produce proof of his or her authority as an inspector.

A person who wilfully obstructs an inspector who is in the exercise of a power conferred, or in the performance of a duty imposed, by this section commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, when required under subsection (3)(a) to give the person’s name and address or to produce proof of identity—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to do so; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: gives a false or misleading name or address,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: If an inspector seizes any property while exercising a power conferred, or performing a duty imposed, by this section, section 102 of the Criminal Procedure Ordinance (Cap. 221) applies as if the inspector were the police within the meaning of that section and the property were property that had come into possession of the police in connection with a criminal offence.
For the purposes of subsection (8), an article transferred to an inspector as mentioned in section 13O(2) is regarded as an article seized by the inspector.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: proof of identity (身分證明文件) has the meaning given by section 17B(1) of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115).

section.name: s14
section.heading: Alteration of vessel, aircraft or vehicle for the purpose of smuggling

subsection.leadIn: Any person who alters the fittings, fabric or structure, or makes use of the altered fittings, fabric or structure, of any vessel, aircraft or vehicle for the purpose of smuggling any article into or out of Hong Kong shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $2,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years. (Amended 1 of 1994 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner, any authorized officer or any member of the Customs and Excise Service reasonably suspects that any vessel, aircraft or vehicle has been used or is intended to be used for the purpose of smuggling; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the vessel, aircraft or vehicle is found in Hong Kong to have—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any false bulkhead, bow, side or bottom;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any secret or disguised place adapted for the purpose of concealing any article; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any hole, pipe or other device adapted for the purpose of smuggling,

subsection.continued: the fittings, fabric or structure of the vessel, aircraft or vehicle shall be presumed to have been altered for the purpose of smuggling an article into or out of Hong Kong in the absence of evidence to the contrary. (Amended L.N. 294 of 1982)

section.name: s14A
section.heading: Construction, etc., of vessels for the purpose of smuggling

subsection.leadIn: Any person who constructs a vessel of less than 250 gross tons for the purpose of smuggling is guilty of an offence and liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $2,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years. (Amended 1 of 1994 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: Any person who repairs or maintains a vessel of less than 250 gross tons constructed for the purpose of smuggling is guilty of an offence and liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $2,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years. (Amended 1 of 1994 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: Any person found on board a vessel of less than 250 gross tons knowing that the vessel is being used for the purpose of smuggling is guilty of an offence and liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $2,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years. (Amended 1 of 1994 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: The master or other person in charge of a vessel of less than 250 gross tons used for the purpose of smuggling is guilty of an offence and liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $2,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years. (Amended 1 of 1994 s. 7)

subsection.content: Any vessel of less than of 250 gross tons that is under construction for the purpose of smuggling is deemed to be a vessel constructed or used for the purpose of smuggling.

subsection.leadIn: In subsections (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5), where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner, and authorized officer or any member of the Customs and Excise Service reasonably suspects that a vessel has been used or is intended to be used for the purpose of smuggling; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is a vessel that has—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any false bulkhead, bow, side or bottom;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any secret or disguised place adapted for the purpose of concealing any article;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any hole, pipe or other device adapted for the purpose of smuggling;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a facility to mount one or more than one outboard engine where the total power of the engine or engines could exceed 168 kilowatts; (Replaced 16 of 2009 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: fuel tanks or other on board fuel capacity exceeding 817 litres, such tanks or other capacity holding or suitable for holding fuel for outboard motors; or

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: metal plating fitted on the hull of the vessel that could be used for ramming other vessels or for armour protection,

subsection.continued: the vessel, or vessel under construction, shall be presumed to have been under construction, constructed or used for the purpose of smuggling in the absence of evidence to the contrary.

subsection.content: It shall be a defence to a charge under subsection (4) for the master or other person in charge of a vessel to prove that he did not know and could not with reasonable diligence have known that the vessel was used for smuggling.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Duty to provide particulars of all cargo

subsection.leadIn: A person specified in subsection (1A) in relation to a vessel, aircraft or vehicle shall, on any occasion that the vessel, aircraft or vehicle is entering or leaving Hong Kong— (Amended 36 of 1983 s. 3; 24 of 2002 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: furnish any member of the Customs and Excise Service of or above the rank of Inspector a manifest in respect of the cargo being imported or exported in or on the vessel, aircraft or vehicle if he is requested to do so by any such member of the Customs and Excise Service; and (Amended 46 of 1977 s. 17; 36 of 1983 s. 3; 62 of 1993 s. 6)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow any member of the Customs and Excise Service to board the vessel, aircraft or vehicle, inspect the cargo and search the vessel for contraband.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The following persons are specified for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a vessel, the master or agent of the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an aircraft, the commander or the owner of the aircraft;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a vehicle other than a train, the person in charge of the vehicle;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of a train, the handling agent in Hong Kong for the cargo carried by the train. (Added 24 of 2002 s. 2)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of any requirement under subsection (1)(a) to furnish a member of the Customs and Excise Service with a manifest, the manifest may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be given to the member of the Customs and Excise Service in paper form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be given or sent to the member of the Customs and Excise Service in the form of an electronic record, but only if the manner and format in which the information is given or sent comply with any requirements specified under section 11(2) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553) in relation to this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be sent to the member of the Customs and Excise Service using the specified system. (Added 24 of 2002 s. 2. Amended 30 of 2025 s. 15)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.def: In this section, manifest (艙單) means a record prepared as a manifest and containing such of the particulars prescribed under section 17 as the member of the Customs and Excise Service considers sufficient for his purposes. (Added 24 of 2002 s. 2)

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes subsection (1)(a) or (b) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 1 and to imprisonment for 1 month. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

section.name: s16
section.heading: Prohibition against unauthorized placing of cargo on vessels, etc.

subsection.content: No person shall place any cargo in or on any vessel or aircraft without the consent of the owner of the vessel or aircraft.
No person shall place any cargo in or on any vehicle which may leave Hong Kong without the consent of the owner of the vehicle.
Any person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

section.name: s17
section.heading: All cargo to be recorded in manifest

subsection.content: All cargo which is imported or exported shall be recorded in a manifest which shall contain such particulars as the Commissioner may prescribe.
For the purposes of subsection (1) the Commissioner may, by notice published in the Gazette, prescribe the particulars of the cargo and the particulars of the consignment of cargo to be recorded.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Offence of importing or exporting unmanifested cargo

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: imports any unmanifested cargo; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exports any unmanifested cargo,

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $2,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years. (Amended 60 of 1980 s. 4; 3 of 1984 s. 2; 22 of 1991 s. 7)

subsection.content: It shall be a defence to a charge under this section if the defendant proves that he did not know and could not with reasonable diligence have known that the cargo was unmanifested.

section.name: s18A
section.heading: Assisting, etc., in export of unmanifested cargo

subsection.leadIn: Any person who knowingly—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has possession of any cargo;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: assists with the carrying, removing, depositing, harbouring, keeping or concealing of any cargo; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: otherwise deals with any cargo,

subsection.continued: with intent to export the cargo without a manifest or with intent to assist another person to export the cargo without a manifest is guilty of an offence and liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $2,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years. (Amended 1 of 1994 s. 9)

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has possession of any cargo;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: assists with the carrying, removing, depositing, harbouring, keeping or concealing of any cargo; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: otherwise deals with any cargo,

subsection.continued: in circumstances that give rise to a reasonable suspicion that there is intent on the part of that person to export the cargo without a manifest or to assist another person to export the cargo without a manifest, the first mentioned person will be presumed to have such intent in the absence of evidence to the contrary.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Written list showing ports of call to be furnished to the Commissioner

subsection.content: The owner of any vessel shall, if required to do so by the Commissioner, an authorized officer or a member of the Customs and Excise Service, furnish forthwith to the Commissioner or to the authorized officer or member of the Customs and Excise Service, a written list showing, so far as the owner is aware, every port or place at which the vessel has called during the period of 3 months immediately preceding the date of its arrival in Hong Kong. (Amended L.N. 294 of 1982)
Any person who contravenes subsection (1) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 1. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

section.name: s20
section.heading: General powers of members of Customs and Excise Service, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the powers conferred by section 21, any member of the Customs and Excise Service and any authorized officer may, for the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: enter at any reasonable time and search any premises (other than domestic premises) or place registered under this Ordinance or occupied by a person who—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has been registered under this Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has lodged a production notification with the Director;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: has been issued with a validated production notification; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: is the holder of a licence; (Amended 3 of 1973 s. 2; 37 of 1999 s. 4)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: stop, board and search any vessel, aircraft or vehicle;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: require the production or furnishing of— (Amended 30 of 1995 s. 7)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any licence, production notification or validated production notification; (Amended 37 of 1999 s. 4)

subparagraph.name: ia
subparagraph.content: the licence number of any licence where the licence has been issued and sent using the specified system; (Added 30 of 1995 s. 7. Amended 30 of 2025 s. 16)

subparagraph.name: ib
subparagraph.content: any document or information relating to any licence or validated production notification, or to any production notification, declaration or other document required to be lodged, delivered or provided to the Commissioner or Director in connection with the requirements of this Ordinance; (Added 37 of 1999 s. 4)

subparagraph.name: ic
subparagraph.content: the reference number of any production notification or validated production notification; (Added 37 of 1999 s. 4)

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: any record or other document required to be kept by this Ordinance; (Replaced 3 of 1973 s. 2)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: examine and take copies of any licence, production notification or validated production notification, or of any record, document or information referred to in paragraph (c); (Replaced 3 of 1973 s. 2. Amended 37 of 1999 s. 4)

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.leadIn: require any information relating to any licence, production notification or validated production notification, or to any record, document or information referred to in paragraph (c), that is— (Amended 37 of 1999 s. 4)

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: contained in any device found in or on the premises, place, vessel, aircraft or vehicle entered or boarded under this section and which is capable of being retrieved on a computer,

paragraph.name: db
paragraph.content: require any information described in paragraph (da) to be produced in a form in which it can be taken away and in which it is either visible and legible or capable of being retrieved on a computer; (Added 30 of 1995 s. 7)

paragraph.name: dc
paragraph.content: take away the copy so produced under paragraph (db); (Added 30 of 1995 s. 7)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: take, without payment but subject to the issue of an official receipt for it, such sample of any article in respect of which any licence or validated production notification may be issued or any production notification has been lodged under this Ordinance as may be required by the Commissioner for the purpose of examination and investigation; (Amended L.N. 294 of 1982; 37 of 1999 s. 4)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: examine any article if he considers it necessary to do so to ascertain whether or not the provisions of this Ordinance are being, or have been, complied with by any person in respect of that article; or

content.leadIn: stop and search any person entering or leaving Hong Kong:
content.proviso: Provided that no person shall be searched except by a person of the same sex or be searched in a public place if he objects to being so searched.

subsection.leadIn: Any member of the Customs and Excise Service and any authorized officer may require—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person to whom a licence or validated production notification has been issued; (Amended 37 of 1999 s. 4)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person who has been registered under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any servant, employee or agent of any person referred to in paragraph (a) or (b),

subsection.continued: to furnish such information or take such action as may be necessary to enable the member of the Customs and Excise Service or the authorized officer to exercise the powers conferred on him under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: When a sample of any article has been taken by a member of the Customs and Excise Service or an authorized officer pursuant to subsection (1)(e) the Commissioner may, after examination and investigation of it, direct that the sample be returned to the owner thereof or disposed of in such manner as the Commissioner thinks fit. (Amended L.N. 294 of 1982)

section.name: s20A
section.heading: Removal of articles may be prohibited until importer known

subsection.leadIn: In this section and section 20B—
subsection.def: article (物品) means article of cargo;
officer (人員) means any member of the Customs and Excise Service or any authorized officer.

subsection.leadIn: Where any article is upon any vessel, aircraft or vehicle for importation into Hong Kong and an officer, for the purpose of carrying out his functions under this Ordinance, requires to know the identity of the consignee of the article or to verify the particulars supplied to him by any person, or in any document, relating to the identity of the consignee, the officer may give notice to the owner of the vessel, aircraft or vehicle prohibiting such owner from removing, or permitting the removal of, the article—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from the vessel, aircraft or vehicle except to a place specified in the notice, being a place designated by such owner; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: from such place,

subsection.continued: save in accordance with permission therefor granted under subsection (4).

subsection.content: A copy of any notice given under subsection (2) shall, where the goods are to be stored in premises occupied by a person other than the owner of the vessel, aircraft or vehicle, be given also to the person occupying such premises and such person shall not remove, or permit the removal of, the article from his premises save in accordance with permission therefor granted under subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: The officer giving notice under subsection (2) shall, as soon as reasonably practicable, after he knows of the identity, or he verifies the particulars, of the consignee of the article to which the notice relates, permit the person upon whom the notice is served to remove, or permit the removal of, the article from the place where, by virtue of the notice, it may lawfully be kept either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unconditionally, in which case he shall notify the person on whom the notice is served in writing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after examination of the article in accordance with the powers vested in such officer under section 20.

subsection.content: It shall be the duty of the person upon whom a notice is served under subsection (2) or (3), at any time prior to the grant of permission under subsection (4), upon obtaining information as to the identity or particulars of the consignee of the article to which the notice relates, being information not previously supplied by such person to the officer giving the notice, to supply such information to the officer specified in the notice.

section.name: s20B
section.heading: Requirement that articles may be removed from vessel etc. for examination

subsection.content: Where any article is upon any vessel, aircraft or vehicle for importation into Hong Kong and an officer desires, in the exercise of his functions under section 20, to examine such article, but he is of the opinion that such article can be more conveniently examined after it has been removed from such vessel, aircraft or vehicle, he may give notice to the consignee of the article, or, in the case of an article in transit being a prohibited article, to the owner of the vessel, aircraft or vehicle, requiring the article to be removed for examination to premises specified in the notice, being premises nominated by the consignee or such owner, as the case may be.

A copy of any notice given under subsection (1) shall, where the goods are to be removed to premises occupied by a person other than the consignee or such owner, as the case may be, be given also to the person occupying such premises.

subsection.leadIn: The consignee or such owner, as the case may be, and, in the event of a copy of the notice being served upon any occupier under subsection (2), the occupier, shall not remove, or permit the removal of, the article from the premises specified in the notice given under subsection (1) until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the article has been examined by an officer in accordance with the powers vested in such officer under section 20; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an officer has informed such consignee, owner or occupier in writing that such examination is unnecessary.

subsection.leadIn: Where an article is removed to any premises pursuant to a notice given under subsection (1), it shall be the duty of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every person in control of such premises to permit an officer to have access to the article and to examine it in accordance with the powers vested in such officer under section 20; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner to ensure that such examination is made as soon as reasonably practicable.

subsection.content: It may be the condition of any notice given under subsection (1) that the article shall, at all times until it is examined by an officer under section 20, be guarded by an officer and if there is such a condition, an officer may enter upon any place where the article is and take such measures as are reasonably necessary to protect the article from interference.

Any notice, notification or information of any kind under this section or section 20A shall contain or include such information and be given in such manner as may be prescribed. (Replaced 24 of 2002 s. 2)

section.name: s21
section.heading: Special powers of the members of the Customs and Excise Service, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 22, any member of the Customs and Excise Service and any authorized officer may, if he reasonably suspects that there is, in or on any premises or place, vessel, aircraft or vehicle, any article in respect of which an offence has been committed under this Ordinance or which is, or contains, evidence of the commission of such offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter and search any such premises or place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: stop, board, remove, detain and search any vessel, aircraft or vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: Any member of the Customs and Excise Service and any authorized officer may— (Amended 30 1995 s. 8)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: seize any article—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in respect of which he reasonably suspects that an offence has been committed under this Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which he reasonably suspects to be, or to contain, evidence of the commission of such an offence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: seize any vessel which has a tonnage not exceeding 250 gross tons and any vehicle, if he reasonably suspects such vessel or vehicle to have been used in connexion with the commission of an offence under this Ordinance; (Amended 30 1995 s. 8)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: require any information which he reasonably suspects relates to an offence which has been, or may have been, committed under this Ordinance that is—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: contained in any device found in or on the premises, place, vessel, aircraft or vehicle entered or boarded under this section and which is capable of being retrieved on a computer,

paragraph.continued: to be produced on a computer in or on the premises, place, vessel, aircraft or vehicle in a visible and legible form, and examine the information; (Added 30 of 1995 s. 8)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: require any information described in paragraph (c) to be produced in a form in which it can be taken away and in which it is either visible and legible or capable of being retrieved on a computer; and (Added 30 of 1995 s. 8)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: take away the copy so produced under paragraph (d). (Added 30 of 1995 s. 8)

subsection.content: Subject to section 22, any member of the Customs and Excise Service or any authorized officer may enter and search any premises or place connected with the manufacture, processing, production, storage, distribution or sale of any article in respect of which a licence or validated production notification has been issued or a production notification has been lodged under this Ordinance. (Amended 37 of 1999 s. 5)

The owner of any article, licence, production notification, validated production notification or other document seized by a member of the Customs and Excise Service or an authorized officer under this section may, on application to the Commissioner and subject to such conditions as the Commissioner may impose, photograph or make any other form of copy of the seized article, licence, production notification, validated production notification or document. (Amended L.N. 294 of 1982; 37 of 1999 s. 5)

section.name: s22
section.heading: Restrictions upon exercise of special powers of members of the Customs and Excise Service, etc.

subsection.leadIn: No domestic premises shall be entered and searched by a member of the Customs and Excise Service or an authorized officer unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a magistrate has issued a warrant under subsection (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the Customs and Excise Service of or above the rank of Assistant Superintendent has given an authorization under subsection (3). (Amended 46 of 1977 s. 17; L.N. 294 of 1982)

subsection.content: A magistrate may, if he is satisfied by information on oath that there is reasonable ground for suspecting that there is in any domestic premises any thing which may be seized under section 21, issue a warrant authorizing a member of the Customs and Excise Service or an authorized officer to enter and search the premises.

subsection.leadIn: A member of the Customs and Excise Service of or above the rank of Assistant Superintendent may, if he reasonably suspects— (Amended 46 of 1977 s. 17; L.N. 294 of 1982)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that there is in any domestic premises any thing which may be seized under section 21; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that unless the premises are entered and searched immediately such thing is likely to be removed from the premises,

subsection.continued: authorize in writing a member of the Customs and Excise Service or an authorized officer to enter and search the premises.

subsection.content: A member of the Customs and Excise Service or an authorized officer authorized under subsection (2) or (3) to enter and search any domestic premises may call upon any member of the Customs and Excise Service and any authorized officer to assist him in entering and searching the premises.

No vessel which has a tonnage exceeding 250 gross tons shall be detained under section 21(1) for more than 12 hours without the consent of the Chief Secretary for Administration, who may, by order in writing under his hand, detain such a vessel for further periods of not more than 12 hours each. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

No aircraft shall be detained under section 21(1) for more than 6 hours without the consent of the Chief Secretary for Administration, who may, by order in writing under his hand, detain an aircraft for further periods of not more than 6 hours each. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)
Any order made by the Chief Secretary for Administration under subsection (5) or (6) shall state the times from which and for which the order shall be effective. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

section.name: s23
section.heading: Powers of arrest of authorized officers and members of the Customs and Excise Service

subsection.content: Any member of the Customs and Excise Service and any authorized officer may, subject to subsection (2), arrest or detain for further inquiries without warrant any person whom he reasonably suspects of having committed any offence under this Ordinance.

content.leadIn: Any member of the Customs and Excise Service and any authorized officer who arrests any person under subsection (1) shall take the person to a police station or, if further inquiries are necessary, first to the office of the Customs and Excise Service or the office of an authorized officer and then to a police station, there to be dealt with in accordance with the provisions of the Police Force Ordinance (Cap. 232): (Amended 62 of 1993 s. 7)
content.proviso: Provided that in no case shall any person be detained for more than 48 hours without being charged and brought before a magistrate.

subsection.content: If any person forcibly resists or attempts to evade arrest under this section, the member of the Customs and Excise Service or the authorized officer may use such force as is reasonably neccessary to effect the arrest.

If any member of the Customs and Excise Service or any authorized officer has reason to believe that a person whom he intends to arrest (hereinafter in this section referred to as the suspected offender) has entered into or is in any place or premises, any person residing in or in charge of such place or premises shall, on demand by the member or authorized officer, allow him free entry thereto and afford all reasonable facilities to search for the suspected offender therein.

If entry to such premises or place cannot be obtained under subsection (4) a member of the Customs and Excise Service or an authorized officer, in any case in which a warrant to enter and search such premises or place may issue but cannot be obtained without affording the suspected offender an opportunity to escape, may enter the premises or place and therein search for the suspected offender and for the purpose of entry or search may break open any outer or inner door or window of the premises or place.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Ancillary powers of investigation of suspected offence
section.leadIn: Any member of the Customs and Excise Service and any authorized officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: use such force as is reasonably necessary to enter any place or premises which he is empowered by this Ordinance to enter and search;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: use such force as is reasonably necessary to stop, board, remove, detain and search any vessel, aircraft or vehicle which he is empowered by this Ordinance to stop, board, remove, detain and search;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: use such force as is reasonably necessary to remove any person or thing obstructing him in the exercise of any power conferred on him by this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: detain any person found in any premises or place which he is empowered by this Ordinance to search until such premises or place has been searched;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: prevent any person from approaching, boarding or leaving any vessel, aircraft or vehicle which he is empowered by this Ordinance to stop, board and search until it has been searched;

content.leadIn: search the person and property and effects of any person whom he reasonably suspects of being guilty of an offence under this Ordinance:
content.proviso: Provided that no person shall be searched except by a person of the same sex or be searched in a public place if he objects to being so searched.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Locks and seals on premises, vessels, etc.

subsection.content: Any member of the Customs and Excise Service and any authorized officer may, for the purpose of exercising the powers conferred on him by this Ordinance, place a lock or seal on any premises or place, or on any vessel, aircraft, vehicle or article.

content.leadIn: If a member of the Customs and Excise Service or an authorized officer has placed a lock or seal on any premises, or on any vessel, aircraft, vehicle or article, any person who breaks or interferes with such a lock or seal shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 3 months: (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

proviso.name: proviso

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any person breaks or interferes with any such lock or seal in the bona fide belief that it is necessary immediately to break or interfere with the lock or seal in order to prevent—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: injury being suffered by any person; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: damage being incurred to any premises, article, vessel, aircraft or vehicle; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any public officer breaks or interferes with any such lock or seal in the exercise of his lawful duties,

proviso.continued: such person or public officer shall be deemed not to have contravened this subsection.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Obstruction of members of the Customs and Excise Service, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: obstructs a member of the Customs and Excise Service or an authorized officer in the exercise of any power or the performance of any duty conferred or imposed on members of the Customs and Excise Service and authorized officers by this Ordinance; (Amended 36 of 1983 s. 6)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to comply with any requirement, direction or demand given or made by a member of the Customs and Excise Service or an authorized officer in the exercise or performance of any such power or duty; or (Amended 36 of 1983 s. 6)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fails to comply with a notice given him under sections 20A and 20B; (Added 36 of 1983 s. 6)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: contravenes section 20A(3) or 20B(3); (Added 36 of 1983 s. 6)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: fails to supply information which it is his duty to supply under section 20A(5), (Added 36 of 1983 s. 6)

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: Any person who knowingly makes a false report, or furnishes any false or misleading information, to any member of the Customs and Excise Service or any authorized officer in performing his duties under this Ordinance shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Seized articles, etc. liable to forfeiture

subsection.leadIn: There shall be liable to forfeiture—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: any vessel not exceeding 250 gross tons and any vehicle so seized and which has been used in connexion with, or is the subject of, the contravention of any provision of this Ordinance, (Amended 22 of 1991 s. 9)

subsection.continued: whether or not any person has been convicted of an offence in respect of such contravention.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, within 30 days of the seizure of an article, vessel or vehicle, restore any article (other than an article referred to in Schedule 1) or any vessel or vehicle which is liable to forfeiture to the person who appears to him to be the owner thereof or the authorized agent of the owner; and upon such restoration sections 28, 29, 29A, 29B and 30 shall cease to apply to the article, vessel or vehicle. (Amended 30 of 1995 s. 9)

The Commissioner shall, subject to subsection (3A) and not later than 30 days beginning on the date of the seizure of an article, vessel or vehicle, serve notice of the seizure on a person who was to the knowledge of the Commissioner at the time of, or immediately after, seizure, an owner of the article, vessel or vehicle. (Replaced 62 of 1993 s. 8)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) shall not apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the article, vessel or vehicle was seized in the presence of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an owner, or an employee or agent of the owner, of the article, vessel or vehicle;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the person whose offence or suspected offence gave rise to the seizure; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a vessel or vehicle, the master or person in charge; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an owner who does not have a permanent address in Hong Kong at the time of seizure. (Added 62 of 1993 s. 8)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.content: Notwithstanding anything in subsection (3A)(a), where the Commissioner believes that the article, vessel or vehicle is a stolen article, vessel or vehicle, he shall serve notice of the seizure within the period specified in subsection (3), on a person whom he believed at the time of, or immediately after, seizure, to be an owner of the article, vessel or vehicle. (Added 62 of 1993 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: A notice given under subsection (3) or (3B) shall be deemed to have been duly served if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is delivered to the person on whom it is to be served;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: where it cannot be served in accordance with paragraph (a) or (b), the notice is exhibited at the Customs and Excise Department, in a place to which the public have access, for a period of not less than 7 days commencing within 30 days from the date of the seizure of the article, vessel or vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: If an article, vessel or vehicle is liable to forfeiture under subsection (1), the owner or the authorized agent of the owner of the article, vessel or vehicle or a person who was in possession of the article, vessel or vehicle at the time of seizure, or a person who has a legal or equitable interest in the article, vessel or vehicle, may within 30 days beginning—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date of the seizure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where notice under subsection (3) or (3B) is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: served by delivery to the person to be served, on the date of service;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: sent by registered post, 2 days after the date of posting; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: exhibited as describe in subsection (4)(c), on the first day it is so exhibited,

subsection.continued: give notice in writing to the Commissioner claiming that the article, vessel or vehicle is not liable to forfeiture and of his full name and address for service in Hong Kong. (Replaced 62 of 1993 s. 8)

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.content: Where a claimant does not have a permanent address in Hong Kong, the notice to the Commissioner under subsection (5) shall nominate a solicitor qualified to practise under the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159), by including the name and address of the solicitor, who is authorized to accept service on his behalf in relation to any forfeiture proceedings. (Added 62 of 1993 s. 8)

subsection.name: 5B
subsection.content: If a notice referred to in subsection (5A) does not include the name and address of a solicitor as required under that subsection, it shall be regarded as if no notice had been given. (Added 62 of 1993 s. 8)

subsection.name: 5C
subsection.content: Service of process in relation to forfeiture under this Ordinance at an address given under subsection (5) or on a solicitor nominated under subsection (5A), shall be good service on the claimant. (Added 62 of 1993 s. 8. Amended 1 of 1994 s. 10)

subsection.name: 5D
subsection.content: A claimant may withdraw a notice of a claim at any time in writing to the Commissioner. (Added 62 of 1993 s. 8)

If, on the date of expiration of the appropriate period of time specified in subsection (5) for the giving of a notice of claim, under that subsection, no such notice has been given in writing to the Commissioner the article, vessel or vehicle shall be forfeited forthwith to the Government. (Amended 66 of 2000 s. 3)

section.name: s28
section.heading: Determination of applications for forfeiture

subsection.content: When a notice of claim is given under section 27(5), the Commissioner or an authorized officer shall apply to a magistrate, the District Court or the Court of First Instance for the forfeiture of the article, vessel or vehicle and shall state in the application the name and address of the claimant or in the case of a claimant who does not have a permanent address in Hong Kong, the name and address of the solicitor authorized to accept service as specified in the notice of the claim. (Amended L.N. 294 of 1982; 62 of 1993 s. 9; 25 of 1998 s. 2)

When an application under subsection (1) is made to a magistrate, the magistrate shall issue a summons to the claimant, requiring him to appear before a magistrate upon the hearing of the application, and shall cause a copy of such summons to be served upon the Commissioner. (Amended L.N. 294 of 1982)

subsection.name: 2AA
subsection.content: When an application under subsection (1) is made to the District Court or the Court of First Instance, it shall be made and proceeded with in accordance with rules of court, and may be begun by motion. (Added 1 of 1994 s. 11. Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: Where the claimant is the defendant in criminal proceedings before a court and there is no other claimant, on an application made in that behalf by the Commissioner, the court may hear the forfeiture application immediately following the criminal proceedings and for the purposes of a hearing under this subsection, any requirement in respect of the issue or service of a summons or any notice of the hearing under or by virtue of subsection (2) or (2AA), as the case may be, shall not apply. (Added 62 of 1993 s. 9)

If, upon the hearing of an application under subsection (1), the claimant or some other person who, though not the claimant, was, or would have been, entitled to make a claim under section 27(5), appears before a court, the court shall hear the application.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: A court may, at the hearing of a forfeiture application, or at an adjourned hearing, hear a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who has not been served with a notice of seizure and was not present when an article, vessel or vehicle was seized; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whose identity was not known to the Commissioner at the time of, or immediately after, seizure; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: who appears to the court to have a right to claim ownership of, or a legal or equitable interest in, the article, vessel or vehicle,

subsection.continued: on his claim as to why the article, vessel or vehicle should not be forfeited. (Added 62 of 1993 s. 9)

subsection.leadIn: If, upon the hearing of an application under subsection (1), neither the claimant nor any other person who, though not the claimant, was, or would have been, entitled to make a claim under section 27(5), appears before a court and the court is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that a person at the address for service, including a solicitor nominated to accept service on behalf of a claimant, has refused to accept service of the summons or the notice of the hearing referred to in paragraph (a); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the address for service given to the Commissioner is inadequate to effect service of the summons of the notice of the hearing referred to in paragraph (a),

subsection.continued: the court shall hear and determine the application without requiring further inquiry as to the whereabouts of the claimant. (Replaced 1 of 1994 s. 11)

subsection.content: Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, an application under subsection (1) to a magistrate shall be deemed to be a complaint for the purposes of section 8 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227).

subsection.leadIn: Upon the hearing of an application under subsection (1) a court shall order that the article, vessel or vehicle, as the case may be, be forfeited to the Government— (Amended 66 of 2000 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case where—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person who appears before the court fails to satisfy the court that he was, or would have been, entitled to make a claim under section 27(5) in respect of the seized article, vessel or vehicle; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: no other person appears before the court and satisfies it that he was, or would have been, entitled to make such claim; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the court is satisfied that the article, vessel or vehicle is liable to forfeiture; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case where the court is satisfied that the article—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is liable to forfeiture; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is such an article as is referred to in Schedule 1. (Amended 30 of 1995 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: Upon the hearing of the application under subsection (1), in any case other than a case referred to in subsection (6)(a) or (b) a court may, if it is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that a person is, or would have been, entitled to make a claim under section 27(5) in respect of the seized article, vessel or vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the article (not being such an article as is referred to in Schedule 1), vessel or vehicle is liable to forfeiture, (Amended 30 of 1995 s. 10)

subsection.continued: order that the article, vessel or vehicle—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: be forfeited to the Government; (Amended 66 of 2000 s. 3)

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: be delivered to the claimant subject to any condition which it may specify in the order; or (Amended 62 of 1993 s. 9)

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: be disposed of in such manner and subject to any such condition as it may specify in the order.

subsection.leadIn: Upon the hearing of the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certified true copy of the record of the proceedings, including the decision of the court, in any proceedings in respect of the contravention of any provision of this Ordinance shall be admissible in evidence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certificate issued by a Certifying Authority certifying the gross tonnage of any vessel shall, upon production of the certificate and without proof of the signature thereon, be admissible as prima facie evidence of the facts stated therein. (Amended 22 of 1991 s. 10)

subsection.def: In subsection (8), Certifying Authority (核准當局) means the Director of Marine or any person authorized by him as a certifying authority under the Merchant Shipping (Registration) (Tonnage) Regulations (Cap. 415 sub. leg. C). (Added 22 of 1991 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: If, after a court has ordered that an article, vessel or vehicle be delivered to a person, that person cannot be found or refuses to accept the article, vessel or vehicle, the Commissioner may apply to a court which may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: order that the article, vessel or vehicle be forfeited; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make any other order as it considers fit in the circumstances. (Added 62 of 1993 s. 9)

section.name: s29
section.heading: Power to release seized vessels and vehicles prior to the hearing

subsection.content: Where an application has been made under section 28(1) in respect of a vessel or vehicle which is liable to forfeiture, a court may, upon payment into court by way of security of a sum of money not less in amount than the value of the seized vessel or vehicle, as assessed by the Commissioner or an authorized officer, order that the vessel or vehicle be delivered to the claimant thereof upon the condition that the vessel or vehicle be re-delivered into the custody of the Commissioner before the date of hearing of the application.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a court has ordered under subsection (1) that a seized vessel or vehicle be delivered to the claimant thereof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the vessel or vehicle is not delivered into the custody of the Commissioner before the date of the hearing of the application,

subsection.continued: the court hearing the application may, in lieu of ordering under section 28(6) or (7) that the vessel or vehicle be forfeited to the Government, order that the money paid into court under subsection (1) of this section be forfeited to the Government or returned to the person who paid it into court. (Amended 66 of 2000 s. 3)

subsection.content: A claimant who applies for the release of a vessel or vehicle shall prior to the release of the vessel or vehicle pay to the Commissioner the reasonable cost of assessing the value of the vessel or vehicle as the court orders. (Added 62 of 1993 s. 10)

section.name: s29A
section.heading: Power to dispose, etc. of perishables, etc.

subsection.leadIn: If an article liable to forfeiture under section 27(1) is, in the opinion of the Commissioner, of a perishable nature or of such a nature that it is difficult to store or is likely to deteriorate before the conclusion of any proceedings relating to it, the Commissioner may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: release the article to the owner or a person entitled to make a claim upon payment by way of security to the Commissioner of an amount of money of not less than the value of the seized article as assessed by the Commissioner or an authorized officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a perishable article, order that the article—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: be sold and the proceeds of the sale be retained by the Commissioner; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: be destroyed; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for an article that is difficult to store or an article that is likely to deteriorate before the conclusion of any proceedings relating to it, apply to a magistrate, the District Court or the Court of First Instance for an order that the article be sold and the proceeds of the sale be retained by the Commissioner. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: The court to which an application has been made under subsection (1)(c) shall not make an order under that subsection unless it is satisfied, in the case where the application is made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the expiry of the period for making a claim under section 27(5), the persons referred to in section 27(3), (3A) and (3B); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after the expiry of the period referred to in paragraph (a), the persons who have given notice to the Commissioner,

subsection.continued: have been given notice of the application for an order to sell the article.

subsection.content: Where an application is made under section 28(1) with respect to an article which is liable to forfeiture under section 27(1), the court may, in lieu of ordering under section 28(6) or (7) that article be forfeited to the Government or be delivered to the claimant, order that the money paid to the Commissioner as security under subsection (1)(a) or retained by the Commissioner under subsection (1)(b) or (c), be forfeited to the Government or paid to the person giving the security or the claimant. (Amended 66 of 2000 s. 3)

section.name: s29B
section.heading: Stay of order on appeal

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), an order by a court for the delivery of an article, vessel or vehicle to a claimant shall be stayed if the Commissioner or the Secretary for Justice lodges an appeal against the order to deliver the article, vessel or vehicle or an application by way of case stated in relation to the order of the court until those proceedings are dealt with by the higher court. (Amended 1 of 1994 s. 14; L.N. 362 of 1997)
The Commissioner may, notwithstanding subsection (1), consent to the delivery of the article, vessel or vehicle.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Claims for the return of forfeited articles, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A claimant may, within 6 weeks after—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the article, vessel or vehicle has been forfeited to the Government under section 27(6) or has been forfeited to the Government by order of a court under section 28(6) or (7); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the determination of any appeal against an order for forfeiture of the article, vessel or vehicle made by a court under section 28(6) or (7),

subsection.continued: give notice in writing to the Commissioner of his intention to submit to the Chief Executive a petition in respect of the forfeited article, vessel or vehicle. (Amended L.N. 294 of 1982; 62 of 1993 s. 12; 1 of 1994 s. 15; 66 of 2000 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: Where a claimant has submitted a petition to the Chief Executive by lodging it in triplicate with the Chief Secretary for Administration within 30 days of giving notice under subsection (1), the Chief Executive may after considering the petition— (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997; 66 of 2000 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: order the return of the forfeited article, vessel or vehicle to the claimant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: stipulate conditions upon which the delivery and transfer of ownership of the forfeited or disposed of article, vessel or vehicle, or the proceeds of any disposal, to the claimant is to be effected; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: reject the petition. (Replaced 62 of 1993 s. 12)

part.name: P6A
part.heading: Transmitting Information Using Specified System by Value-added Service Providers

section.name: s30A
section.heading: Interpretation (Part VIA)
section.def: practice guidelines (實務指引) means the guidelines issued under section 30B(1), and includes the amendments to those guidelines under section 30B(5);
specified information (指明資料) means the classes of information specified in the practice guidelines;
value-added service provider (增值服務提供者) means a person approved under section 30D(2) to transmit, on behalf of another person, any specified information using the specified system.

section.name: s30B
section.heading: Commissioner may issue practice guidelines

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 30C, the Commissioner may issue guidelines specifying any class of information to which this Part applies.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may also specify in the practice guidelines any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the manner in which an application under section 30D(1) is to be made;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the specific matters that the Commissioner may have regard to for the purposes of section 30D(3);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the standard at which a value-added service provider is expected to provide its services.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must publish the practice guidelines in a manner appropriate to bring them to the notice of the persons affected by them; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must make copies of the practice guidelines available to the public (whether in hard copy form or electronic form).

subsection.content: The practice guidelines are not subsidiary legislation.
The Commissioner may amend or revoke any of the practice guidelines.
Subsections (3) and (4) apply to an amendment or revocation of the practice guidelines in the same way as they apply to the practice guidelines.

section.name: s30C
section.heading: Only value-added service providers may transmit specified information using specified system on behalf of other persons

subsection.content: A person who is not a value-added service provider must not transmit, on behalf of another person, any specified information using the specified system.
A value-added service provider must not transmit, on behalf of another person, any specified information using the specified system except with that other person’s written authorization.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s30D
section.heading: Application to be approved as value-added service providers

subsection.content: A person who holds a valid business registration certificate issued under section 6 of the Business Registration Ordinance (Cap. 310) may apply to the Commissioner for approval to transmit, on behalf of another person, any specified information using the specified system.
On an application made under subsection (1), the Commissioner may grant, or refuse to grant, the approval.

In considering an application, the Commissioner may have regard to any matters that the Commissioner considers relevant, including whether the applicant has failed to comply with any practice guidelines.
On granting an approval, the Commissioner may impose terms or conditions on the approval that the Commissioner considers appropriate.

section.name: s30E
section.heading: Commissioner’s powers relating to value-added service providers’ misconducts

subsection.leadIn: If, in the opinion of the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a value-added service provider contravenes any terms or conditions imposed under section 30D(4) on the provider’s approval; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a value-added service provider is no longer fit to be such a provider,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner may take any of the actions specified in subsection (2) against the provider.

subsection.leadIn: The actions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to issue a warning letter to the provider;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to suspend or revoke the provider’s approval.

subsection.content: In forming an opinion for the purposes of subsection (1)(b), the Commissioner may have regard to any matters that the Commissioner considers relevant, including whether the value-added service provider has failed to comply with any practice guidelines.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(b), the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may determine the period that the Commissioner considers appropriate during which an approval will be suspended; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may determine that an approval will be suspended until such terms or conditions as imposed by the Commissioner are complied with to the Commissioner’s satisfaction.

section.name: s30F
section.heading: Presumption regarding information transmitted by value-added service providers using specified system

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any information is received by the Commissioner or the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information is transmitted to the Commissioner or the Director using the specified system.

subsection.leadIn: Where the information was transmitted, on behalf of another person, by a value-added service provider with that other person’s written authorization—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person named in the information as the person who transmitted the information is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, to be regarded for the purposes of this Ordinance as the person who transmitted the information; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person named in the information as the person who made a statement or declaration contained in the information is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, to be regarded for the purposes of this Ordinance as the person who made the statement or declaration.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Power to make regulations

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations for all or any of the following purposes— (Amended 66 of 2000 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prohibiting the import and export of any article;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prohibiting the import and export of any article except under and in accordance with the terms and conditions of a licence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: providing for the issue of licences to import or export any article;

paragraph.name: ca
cb
paragraph.content: prescribing any article or a class or description of an article the import or export of which except under and in accordance with a licence is prohibited under this Ordinance; (Added 62 of 1993 s. 13)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: prescribing conditions to be observed by any person before or after the issue of an import licence or an export licence;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: imposing upon owners of ships, aircraft and vehicles, masters of ships, commanders of aircraft and persons in charge of vehicles such obligations in respect of manifests, bills of lading, air waybills, air consignment notes and such other similar matters as may be necessary for carrying into effect the provisions of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: imposing other conditions or restrictions on the import or export of any article;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: imposing conditions or restrictions on any cargo placed in or on any vessel, aircraft or vehicle for the purpose of import or export;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: controlling the examination and storage of articles imported or exported or about to be imported or exported;

paragraph.name: ha
paragraph.content: requiring any person in charge of a vehicle entering or leaving Hong Kong to give such information in respect of the vehicle as may be necessary for giving effect to this Ordinance; (Added 8 of 2007 s. 3)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: requiring any person importing or exporting any article or any person involved in the importing or exporting of any article to give any specified information in respect of the article before or after it has been imported or exported; (Amended 8 of 2007 s. 3)

paragraph.name: ia
paragraph.content: empowering the Commissioner or the Director to specify any form or requirement for giving information required to be given to the Commissioner or the Director under this Ordinance; (Added 30 of 1995 s. 11. Amended 24 of 2002 s. 2; 8 of 2007 s. 3)

paragraph.name: j
ja
paragraph.content: providing for the imposition of conditions in the discretion of the Commissioner on the carriage of articles prescribed by the regulations or by the Director in accordance with the requirements of this Ordinance on or by vessels in the waters of Hong Kong including activities incidental to the transportation on land of the articles to the vessels and loading of such articles on to such vessels and for the issue of licences by the Commissioner to regulate all such activities; (Added 22 of 1991 s. 11. Amended 1 of 1994 s. 16)

paragraph.name: k
l
paragraph.content: providing for the issue of certificates in respect of preferential customs tariffs and for conditions which may be attached to such certificate;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: providing for the registration of any person applying for the issue of any licence or validated production notification, or any person required to lodge a production notification or any other document under this Ordinance, or any combination thereof, and for conditions which may be attached to such registration; (Amended 37 of 1999 s. 6)

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: providing for the registration of any person importing, exporting, manufacturing, processing, storing, distributing, selling or dealing with any article in respect of which any licence or validated production notification may be issued, or in respect of which any production notification or other document is required to be lodged under this Ordinance, or any combination thereof, and for the conditions which may be attached to the registration of any such person; (Amended 37 of 1999 s. 6)

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.leadIn: providing for the registration of any premises—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in respect of which any licence or validated production notification may be issued, or in respect of which any production notification or other document is required to be lodged under this Ordinance, or any combination thereof; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: connected with the importing, exporting, manufacture, processing, storage, distribution, sale or other dealing with any article in respect of which any licence or validated production notification may be issued, or in respect of which any production notification or other document is required to be lodged under this Ordinance, or any combination thereof,

paragraph.continued: and prescribing any condition upon the registration of such premises; (Amended 37 of 1999 s. 6)

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: providing for the cancellation, revocation or suspension for any period of the registration of any person where the Director is satisfied that the person so registered has contravened any condition of any licence, validated production notification or other document issued under this Ordinance; (Amended 37 of 1999 s. 6)

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.content: providing for the imposition and administration of quota controls in respect of the import or export of any article;

paragraph.name: r
paragraph.content: providing for the sale or transfer of any quota and for the conditions under which any quota may be sold or transferred;

paragraph.name: s
t
paragraph.content: requiring importers, exporters, carriers, owners and manufacturers to furnish to the Director or any other specified public officer information for the purpose of compiling statistics of trade with any person or body of persons, corporate or unincorporate, carrying on business or other activities outside Hong Kong; (Amended 23 of 1998 s. 2)

paragraph.name: u
paragraph.content: prohibiting or controlling the publication or disclosure of information or particulars furnished to the Commissioner or the Director, an authorized officer, an appointed officer or a member of the Customs and Excise Service under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: ua
paragraph.content: controlling the use of a security device issued by a specified body for authenticating information to be sent for the purposes of this Ordinance using services provided by a specified body; (Added 30 of 1995 s. 11)

paragraph.name: ub
paragraph.content: prohibiting the unauthorized sending of information for the purposes of this Ordinance by a specified agent on behalf of a person using services provided by a specified body; (Added 30 of 1995 s. 11)

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: providing for the verification of any particulars or information required to be furnished by any person under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: w
paragraph.content: providing that any person who fails to submit any document or furnish any information to the Commissioner or the Director or other specified public officer within a prescribed period of time shall be liable to pay a prescribed sum of money, which sum shall be a civil debt due to and recoverable by the Government; (Amended 66 of 2000 s. 3)

paragraph.name: wa
x
10a
paragraph.content: without limiting paragraph (x), prescribing fees to be collected by the Commissioner in respect of any information transmitted using the specified system, and generally to prescribe the mode and time of payment of such fees; (Added 30 of 2025 s. 18)

paragraph.name: y
paragraph.content: empowering the Director to determine the form of any licence and any undertaking required under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: z
paragraph.content: providing that the Director-General of Trade and Industry may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend the Schedule to any regulation made under this Ordinance, other than a Schedule or a part of a Schedule referred to in section 6B(1) or 6F; (Amended L.N. 292 of 1989; 1 of 1994 s. 16; L.N. 173 of 2000)

paragraph.name: za
zb
zc
paragraph.content: without prejudice to the generality of paragraph (z), specifying any matter referred to in paragraph (zb) in a Schedule to any regulation made under this Ordinance, and providing that the Director-General of Trade and Industry may, by order published in the Gazette, amend that Schedule; (Added 37 of 1999 s. 6. Amended L.N. 173 of 2000)

paragraph.name: zd
paragraph.content: empowering the Director to determine a process to be the process of manufacturing any specified textiles for the purposes of the definition of production in section 6AA(1); (Added 37 of 1999 s. 6)

paragraph.name: ze
paragraph.content: empowering the Director to specify a particular as material for the purposes of the definition of material particular in section 6AA(1); (Added 37 of 1999 s. 6)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: levying, with or without exception or exemption, a charge on persons or any category of persons who furnish particulars pursuant to any regulation made under this section, and prescribing the amount or method of ascertaining the amount of such charge and the mode and time of payment thereof;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: imposing or providing for the imposition of a pecuniary penalty, recoverable civilly, on any person who, being required under any regulation made under this Ordinance to lodge a declaration with the Commissioner in connexion with the import or export of any article, fails to lodge such a declaration or fails to lodge such a declaration within a prescribed period of time;

paragraph.name: ac
ad
ae
af
paragraph.content: prescribing any thing which is to be or may be prescribed under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: ag
paragraph.content: generally for the better carrying out of the provisions and purposes of this Ordinance. (Amended L.N. 294 of 1982)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Regulations made for the purposes of subsection (1)(x) or (aa) may provide that any fee or charge payable in connection with information that is sent using services provided by a specified body shall be paid in such manner as may be agreed between the Government and the specified body. (Added 24 of 2002 s. 2)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: Regulations made for the purposes of subsection (1)(x), (xa) or (aa) may provide that any fee or charge payable in connection with information that is transmitted using the specified system must be paid in the manner specified by the Commissioner. (Added 30 of 2025 s. 18)
Subject to subsection (3), regulations made under this section may provide that a contravention of any such regulation shall be an offence and may prescribe penalties therefor.

Regulations made under this section may prescribe that a contravention or breach thereof shall be punishable by a fine not exceeding $500,000 and imprisonment for a term not exceeding 2 years. (Amended 60 of 1980 s. 5)
No regulation made under subsection (1)(aa), (ab), (ac), (ad) or (ae) shall come into operation until it has been approved by resolution of the Legislative Council. (Amended L.N. 150 of 2014)

section.name: s32
section.heading: Power to levy by resolution of Legislative Council
section.content: The Legislative Council may by resolution provide for the imposition of a levy upon any person required under this Ordinance to furnish information for the purpose of compiling statistics of trade with any person or body of persons, corporate or unincorporate, carrying on business or other activities outside Hong Kong and to provide for the method of determination of the levy and the mode and time of payment thereof.

section.name: s32A
section.heading: Provision of information where use of specified system is not practicable

subsection.content: This section applies to any information that under a provision of this Ordinance (a relevant provision) is required to be given to another person by using the specified system. (Amended 30 of 2025 s. 19)

subsection.leadIn: Where the Commissioner considers that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is not practicable for any information to which this section applies to be given in the manner specified in subsection (1), he may determine that the information shall be given in paper form and shall not be given by using the specified system; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is not practicable for any information to which this section applies to be given solely in the manner specified in subsection (1), he may determine that the information shall be given either in paper form or by using the specified system,

subsection.continued: and where a determination has been made under this subsection, the relevant provision shall have effect subject to that determination. (Amended 30 of 2025 s. 19)

subsection.content: Notice of a determination made under subsection (2) shall be published in the Gazette within 14 days of the determination having been made.

A determination made under subsection (2) may require that the information to be given in paper form be certified as correct or that the document containing the information be certified as a true copy, as may be appropriate, by the person giving the information or by some other person.
A determination made under subsection (2) may make different provision in relation to different classes of persons or information.

section.name: s32B
section.heading: Provision of manifest information relating to cargo carried in a road vehicle

subsection.content: This section applies to any information that is contained in the manifest of cargo carried in or on a vehicle other than a train and that under this Ordinance is required to be given to the Commissioner or the Director, or to an officer appointed by the Commissioner, by using the specified system. (Amended 30 of 2025 s. 20)

The Commissioner may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify that any information to which this section applies shall be given in paper form and, where a notice published under this subsection has effect, the information shall, in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance as read together with the notice, be given in paper form only.

A notice published under subsection (2) may require that the information to be given in paper form be certified as correct or that the document containing the information be certified as a true copy, as may be appropriate, by the person giving the information or by some other person.
A notice published under subsection (2) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Evidentiary provisions

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings under this Ordinance it shall, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, be presumed that any cargo recorded in an import manifest furnished by— (Amended 1 of 1994 s. 17)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the master of a vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the commander of an aircraft;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person in charge of a vehicle (other than a train) and for cargo carried by train, the handling agent in Hong Kong for the cargo; or (Amended 62 of 1993 s. 14)

paragraph.name: d
