paragraph.content: the owner of such vessel, aircraft or vehicle,

subsection.continued: has been imported in or on such vessel, aircraft or vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings under this Ordinance it shall, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, be presumed that any cargo recorded in an export manifest furnished by— (Amended 1 of 1994 s. 17)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the master of a vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the commander of an aircraft;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person in charge of a vehicle (other than a train) and for cargo carried by train, the handling agent in Hong Kong for the cargo; or (Amended 62 of 1993 s. 14)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the owner of such vessel, aircraft or vehicle,

subsection.continued: at any time before or after the departure from Hong Kong of the vessel, aircraft or vehicle, has been exported, or is intended to be exported, in or on such vessel, aircraft or vehicle.

subsection.content: Any copy of an import manifest or an export manifest produced to the Director, an authorized officer or a member of the Customs and Excise Service under any provision of this Ordinance shall be admissible as evidence of the contents of the import manifest or export manifest of which it is a copy in any proceedings under this Ordinance; and the cargo referred to in the copy of such manifest shall be presumed in the absence of evidence to the contrary, to have been imported or exported as the case may be in or on the vessel, aircraft or vehicle to which the copy of the manifest relates. (Amended 1 of 1994 s. 17)

Any copy of a licence or other document produced to the Director, an authorized officer or a member of the Customs and Excise Service under any provision of this Ordinance shall be admissible as evidence of the contents of the licence or other document of which it is a copy in any proceedings under this Ordinance before a court or magistrate.

section.name: s33A
section.heading: Certificate of record of information sent using specified system

subsection.leadIn: A document purporting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be a copy of the record of any information sent using the specified system and produced from one of the Government’s computer systems; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be certified by the Commissioner or the Director,

subsection.continued: shall be admitted in any proceedings under this Ordinance before a court or magistrate on its production without further proof.

subsection.leadIn: Where a document is produced and admitted as evidence under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the court or magistrate before which it is produced shall, until the contrary is proved, presume—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that it was certified under subsection (1)(b);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that the document is a true copy of the record of information so sent; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: that the record was duly made at the time referred to in the document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the document is evidence of the contents of the information sent by the sender using the specified system.

subsection.content: Where a document is produced and admitted as evidence under subsection (1), the court or magistrate may, if it or he thinks fit, on its or his own motion or on the application of any party to the proceedings, summon the person who certified the document and examine him as to its subject-matter.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Onus of proof in court proceedings

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings under this Ordinance the onus of proving—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the place—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: from which an article has been imported; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to which an article is intended to be exported; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that an article—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has been imported in accordance with the terms of a licence;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is intended to be exported in accordance with the terms of a licence;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: has been imported for the sole purpose of exporting the article;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: has been lawfully placed in or on any vessel, aircraft or vehicle for the purpose of exporting the article;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: has been lawfully removed from any vessel, aircraft or vehicle in or on which it was imported;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: has been lawfully delivered to or placed in any premises or place after it has been imported; or

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: has been recorded in the manifest of the vessel, aircraft or vehicle in or on which it has been imported or is intended to be exported,

subsection.continued: shall lie upon the defendant in any such criminal proceedings and the claimant in any forfeiture proceedings.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, the provisions of Part IV of the Evidence Ordinance (Cap. 8) (which relates to the admissibility of hearsay evidence in civil proceedings) shall apply as if proceedings under this Ordinance were civil proceedings.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Application of Ordinance to postal packets

subsection.content: The provisions of this Ordinance shall apply to any article contained in a postal packet.

Notwithstanding the provisions of subsection (1), a postal packet contained in a sealed mail bag shall, if the mail bag is listed in the manifest of the vessel, aircraft or vehicle in or on which it is imported or exported, not be construed as cargo for the purposes of this Ordinance.

Any authorized officer or any member of the Customs and Excise Service may, in the presence of and under the directions of an officer of the Post Office, open and examine any postal packet held in the custody of the Post Office.

subsection.def: For the purposes of this section, the terms mail bag (郵袋), Post Office (郵政署), officer of the Post Office (郵政署人員) and postal packet (郵包) shall have the meanings assigned to such terms, respectively, under section 2 of the Post Office Ordinance (Cap. 98).

section.name: s35A
section.heading: Assisting, etc., in carriage of prohibited, etc., articles

subsection.leadIn: Any person who knowingly—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has possession of any article, the carriage of which is restricted under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has possession of any article, the export of which is prohibited under any law in force in Hong Kong or is prohibited other than in accordance with a licence issued under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: assists with the carrying, removing, depositing, harbouring, keeping or concealing of any article, the carriage of which is restricted under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: assists with the carrying, removing, depositing, harbouring, keeping or concealing of any article, the export of which is prohibited under any law in force in Hong Kong or is prohibited other than in accordance with a licence issued under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: otherwise deals with any article, the carriage of which is restricted under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: otherwise deals with any article, the export of which is prohibited under any law in force in Hong Kong or is prohibited other than in accordance with a licence issued under this Ordinance,

subsection.continued: with intent to evade the restriction or prohibition or to assist another person to evade the restriction or prohibition is guilty of an offence and liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in the case where contravention of the restriction or prohibition is punishable otherwise than as an indictable offence, on conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.leadIn: in the case where contravention of the restriction or prohibition is punishable as an indictable offence—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $2,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has possession of any article, the carriage of which is restricted under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has possession of any article, the export of which is prohibited under any law in force in Hong Kong or is prohibited other than in accordance with a licence issued under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: assists with the carrying, removing, depositing, harbouring, keeping or concealing of any article, the carriage of which is restricted under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: assists with the carrying, removing, depositing, harbouring, keeping or concealing of any article, the export of which is prohibited under any law in force in Hong Kong or is prohibited other than in accordance with a licence issued under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: otherwise deals with any article, the carriage of which is restricted under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: otherwise deals with any article, the export of which is prohibited under any law in force in Hong Kong or is prohibited other than in accordance with a licence issued under this Ordinance,

subsection.continued: in circumstances that give rise to a reasonable suspicion that there is intent on the part of that person to evade a restriction or prohibition or to assist another person to evade a restriction or prohibition, the first mentioned person will be presumed to have such intent in the absence of evidence to the contrary.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Offences in respect of licences, production notifications, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Any person, who, in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for the issue of a licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application for registration under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any production notification, declaration, document or article required to be lodged with the Director, an authorized officer or member of the Customs and Excise Service pursuant to the provisions of this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any particulars or information provided to the Director, an authorized officer or member of the Customs and Excise Service in connection with the requirements of this Ordinance, (Added 37 of 1999 s. 7)

subsection.continued: makes or causes to be made any statement or furnishes or causes to be furnished any information which is false or misleading in a material particular or omits any material particular shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years, unless he satisfies the court or magistrate that he did not know and had no reason to believe the statement or information to be false or misleading or the omission to be material. (Amended 3 of 1984 s. 3; 30 of 1995 s. 13)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: A person who fails to comply with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any provision of section 6AB; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any condition imposed on a validated production notification,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years. (Added 37 of 1999 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: forges any licence or validated production notification;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without the authority of the Director makes any alteration to any licence or validated production notification; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: knowingly utters or makes use of any licence or validated production notification that has been forged or, without the authority of the Director, altered,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years. (Replaced 3 of 1984 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: Any person who furnishes or causes to be furnished to another person a production notification that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he knows or has reason to believe may be lodged with the Director for validation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been signed by him in blank or with the material particulars incomplete,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years. (Added 37 of 1999 s. 7)

subsection.def: For the purpose of this section, material particular (要項), in relation to a production notification, means material particular as defined in section 6AA(1). (Added 37 of 1999 s. 7)

section.name: s36A
section.heading: Offences by directors, partners, etc.

subsection.content: Where an offence under section 36 is committed by a body corporate, every person who, at the time of the commission of the offence, was a director, manager, secretary or other similar officer of the body corporate or any person who was purporting to act in any such capacity, shall be guilty of the like offence unless he proves that the offence was committed without his knowledge or that he exercised all due diligence to prevent the commission of the offence. (Amended 37 of 1999 s. 8)

Where an offence under section 36 committed by a partner in a partnership is proved to have been committed with the consent or connivance of, or to be attributable to any act on the part of, any other partner of the partnership or any person concerned in the management of the partnership, that other partner or the person concerned in the management of the partnership commits the like offence. (Added 37 of 1999 s. 8)

section.name: s36B
section.heading: Consent of Chief Executive not required for institution of criminal proceedings
section.text: Notwithstanding subsection (2) of section 23C of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200), that section shall not apply to any proceedings for an indictable offence under this Ordinance.

section.name: s36C
section.heading: Offence relating to the use or keeping of a security device
section.content: Where a person who has been issued with a security device contravenes section 2C(a) or (b), he commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s36D
section.heading: Offence by specified agent
section.content: A specified agent who contravenes section 2D commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Time limitation for criminal proceedings
section.content: In any case of an offence, other than an indictable offence, under this Ordinance, a complaint shall be made or an information laid in respect of such offence within 2 years from the time when the matter of such complaint or information respectively arose.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Informers
section.content: Save where, in the opinion of the court, justice so requires, the name or identity of any informer and the information given by such informer shall not be disclosed in any civil or criminal proceedings and the court may make any order and adopt any procedure necessary to prevent any such disclosure.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Amendment of Schedules

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may amend Schedule 1 by notice published in the Gazette. (Amended 30 of 1995 s. 15; 66 of 2000 s. 3)

The Secretary for Commerce and Economic Development may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 2 or 3. (Added 30 of 1995 s. 15. Amended L.N. 173 of 2000; L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007)
The Commissioner of Customs and Excise may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 4. (Added 30 of 2025 s. 24)

section.name: s40
section.heading: General indemnity
section.content: The Commissioner, members of the Customs and Excise Service and authorized officers are indemnified by the owner of an article, vessel or vehicle from liability for damages to the article, vessel or vehicle arising out of the seizure, storage and delivery of the article, vessel or vehicle.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Articles not dealt with under this Ordinance before commencement of Import and Export (Amendment) Ordinance 1993

subsection.leadIn: Where any article, vessel or vehicle has been seized under this Ordinance before the commencement* of the Import and Export (Amendment) Ordinance 1993 (62 of 1993) and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Commissioner is unable to restore the article, vessel or vehicle to the owner as—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the owner cannot be found; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a summons issued under this Ordinance has not been served on a claimant as the Commissioner has insufficient information to arrange service of the summons in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a magistrate has ordered the delivery of the article, vessel or vehicle to a person who cannot be found or who refuses to accept the article, vessel or vehicle,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner may within a period of 6 months beginning on the commencement date, publish in the Gazette, a notice containing the information as he considers necessary inviting any person who has a claim to the article, vessel or vehicle to give notice of claim to the Commissioner within a period specified in the notice.

subsection.content: Where notice is given to the Commissioner under subsection (1), section 28 as amended by the Import and Export (Amendment) Ordinance 1993 (62 of 1993) shall apply to the notice of claim as if it were a claim under section 27(5).

If no notice of claim is given to the Commissioner within the period specified in the notice in the Gazette, the article, vessel or vehicle shall be forfeited to the Government. (Amended 66 of 2000 s. 3)

section.name: s43
